AT&T Service Specification

Category: Album
Service: Locker
1.1.0
1/13/2014
Developer Realization Team

Revision History

Date
Revision
Description
1/13/14
1.0.0
bs595r - initial version, carry over from SB spec. Implements the following User Stories: US50112, US50116, US50117, US50118, US50119, US50120, US50121, US50122, US50123, US50124, US50435, US50439
1/19/2014
1.1.0
bs595r - made updates based on reviews. Moved search functionality into the respective resources. Changed token to ticket for upload. Changes the name of Client Properties to Locker properties, and specifies only contentEngineHostname parameter is allowed to be returned. Adds HTTP method override.

7.2 Approvers >

1 Introduction

Give brief introduction about the proposed service. Also add here any special considerations, assumptions, and dependencies for this API
AT&T Locker API gives authorized applications the ability to store, socialize and share user content that resides on users PC and Devices. This Interface Document (IA) gives on overview of Locker API, Payload structure, Errors returned, etc that will help a client developer build Locker client application. This document lists how to invoke API’s but doesn’t discuss orchestrating the API’s to make a business function. The Getting Started Guide and Sequence Diagrams (not included here) will give a good overview of how to orchestrate these API’s to make a business function.

1.1 Audience

The main intended audiences for the document are:
  • API Platform development team
  • Northbound API Governance
  • Security Architecture and Governance
  • Developer Support Program team
  • IT and CTO Architecture teams supporting the AT&T API program
  • API Platform Product Realization Team
  • Testing Organizations
  • Teams Building AT&T branded solutions that leverage the API (e.g. HTML 5 SDK built by Sencha for AT&T)

2 Provisioned Data

In order for the developer to utilize the Locker API, Locker API needs to be selected during onboarding of the Locker Application. A Locker application using the Locker API cannot use other APIs. The Locker Application will also be enabled for Remember Me during onboarding.

2.1 Oauth Scope

Describe what scope (if any) will be used for this service and how that gets provisioned. Include a small graphic that illustrates the desired scope provisioned on developer portal.
Figure 2.1:
Representation of this Messaging service on OnBoarding form
The value for the scope parameter that needs to be passed in the Oauth API method call to obtain an access token to consume this API would be “LOCKER”.

2.2 Provisioning:

N/A

2.3 Notification Callback URL:

N/A

2.4 Callback URL:

N/A

3 RESTful Web Services Definition

AT&T Locker API gives authorized applications the ability to store, socialize and share user content that resides on users PC and Devices. This Interface Document (IA) gives on overview of Locker API, Payload structure, Errors returned, etc that will help a client developer build Locker client application. This document lists how to invoke API’s but doesn’t discuss orchestrating the API’s to make a business function. The Getting Started Guide and Sequence Diagrams (not included here) will give a good overview of how to orchestrate these API’s to make a business function.

HTTP Method Override

If the calling client does not support HTTP DELETE, PATCH and/or PUT, the client may use the following header and call the API using HTTP POST
x-http-method-override: DELETE
or
x-http-method-override: PATCH
or
x-http-method-override: PUT

XML Declaration

The XML documentation declaration shall be optional for requests that have an XML body, but shall be required for responses that have an XML body.

Source Device IP Address

The APIGW shall retrieve the source device IP address and send that with every request to the Locker enabler set in the HTTP header device-remote-address

3.1 REST Operation Summary

This section defines the RESTful web services interface for the ‘Service Name’ API. RESTful APIs are specified in a resource oriented manner. The REST operations supported by each resource are identified along with their JSON and XML representation formats, request parameters, response parameters, response codes and exceptions.
Operation Name

3.2 Operation: Create Album

Replicate this section, and its subordinate sections, for each of the operations supported by the REST resource

3.2.1 Functional Behavior Create Album

This method is used to create a new album . If a user attempts to create an album to a name that is already in use, the api will throw an exception as it is not allowed
The Create Album method is used to create a new album . If a user attempts to create an album to a name that is already in use, an error will be returned.

3.2.2 Call flow

Insert below a sequence diagram (ping pong) diagram in context to a complete call flow or transaction with numbered arrows and some description explaining the sequence as appropriate.

3.2.3 Version Impact Summary

Summarize the different versions of this operation that are in production or deleted by the current release of this service.
Service Version
Major or Minor Impact
Changes Introduced by this Version
1
Major
Initial Release

3.2.4 Authentication and Authorization

Describe OAuth model applicable to this operation.
Authorization Model
Subscriber Authorization required?
OAuth Scope Value
Brief Description
OAuth
authorization_code
Yes
LOCKER
  1. Redirect user to AT&T authorization page to capture User consent
  2. Obtain Token obtained using authorization code issued by the gateway alonf the client key and secret by making an Oauth token call with GrantType=authorization_code

3.2.5 Representation Formats

In the table below, describe supported representation formats for the request and response body. Where different versions support different formats, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table.
Direction
Supported Respresentation Formats
Request
XML, JSON
Response
XML, JSON

3.2.6 Input Parameters

In the table below, describe input parameters. Where different versions support different input parameters, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table. The allowed values for the Location in Request column are: Header, Resource URI, Body or Query Parameter.
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
accept
String
No
Specifies the format of the body of the response. Valid values are:
  • application/json
  • application/xml
The default value is application/json. Per rfc2616: "If no Accept header field is present, then it is assumed that the client accepts all media types." By default our services return application/json.
Normal Accept header processing rules shall be followed according to rfc2616.
Note: If there is no entity body in a normal successful response, this parameter can still be specified to determine the format in the case of an error response message.
Header
accept-encoding
String
No
Specifies the accept encoding format. When this header is present, the gateway should compress the response to indicate the client that response is in compressed format. Valid values are: gzip
Header
authorization
String
Yes
Specifies the authorization type and token. "Bearer" + OAuth Token – access_token. If the authorization header is missing, the system shall return an HTTP 400 Invalid Request message. If the token is invalid the system shall return an HTTP 401 Unauthorized message with a WWW-Authenticate HTTP header.
Header
content-length
Integer
Yes
Specifies the length of the content in octets.
Header
content-type
String
Yes
Specifies the type of content of the body of the entity. Must be set to one of the following values:
  • application/json
  • application/xml
Header
album
Object
Yes
Contains the parameters that define the new album
Body
name
String
Yes
Specifies the name of album
Body
description
String
No
Specifies the description of the album
Body

3.2.6.1 Request – Example (XML)

This demonstrates how to create an album The response format will be in XML.
POST /locker/v1/albums HTTP/1.1 


Host: api.att.com


authorization: bearer abcdef12345678


accept: application/xml


content-type: application/xml




<album>


      <name>somealbum</name>


      <description>Old School</description>


</album>

3.2.6.2 Request – Example (JSON)

This demonstrates how to create an album. The response format will be in JSON.
POST /locker/v1/albums HTTP/1.1 


Host: api.att.com 


authorization: bearer abcdef12345678


accept: application/json


content-type: application/json




{


  "album": {


    "name": "somealbum",


    "description": "Old School"


  }


}

3.2.7 Output Parameters

In the table below, describe output parameters. Where different versions support different output parameters, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table. Note: ‘consent’ refers to end user consent which may need to be obtained before data is returned,
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
content-encoding
string
No
Specifies the type of encoding used on the data. Supported values are: identity or gzip
Header
content-type
string
Yes
Specifies the type of content of the body of the entity. Must be set to one of the following values:
  • application/xml
  • application/json
Note: If there is no entity body in a normal successful response, this parameter is still needed to specify the format in the case of an error response message.
Header
location
AnyURI
Yes
Specifies the location of the newly created resource. This URI can be used to interact with the newly created resource. See Get Album Contents for how the URI is structured.
Header
album
Object
Yes
Contains the album information.
Body

Album Object

This table specifies the parameters that belong to the album object
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
id
String
Yes
Specifies the Id of the content object
body
name
String
Yes
Specifies the name of content
body
creationDate
String
Yes
Specifies the date of file creation in the system.
body
size
Integer
Yes
Specifies the size of linked content (bytes)
body
description
String
Yes
Specifies the description of the entry
body
count
Integer
Yes
Specifies the mime type of file i.e. “video/mp4; charset=binary”
body
previews
Array
Yes
Specifies an array of preview objects
body
preview
Object
Yes
Contains the preview information.
Body

Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description

format
String
Yes
Specifies the format of preview
body
url
AnyURI
Yes
Specifies the download url
body
width
Integer
Yes
Specifies the width of preview (image/video)
body
height
Integer
Yes
Specifies the height of preview (image/video)
body
bitrate
Integer
Yes
Specifies the preview bitrate (audio)
body
channels
Integer
Yes
Specifies the audio channels (audio)
body

3.2.7.1 Response – Example ( XML)

This shows the response to an album creation in XML format.exception
HTTP/1.1 201 Created


date: Wed, 27 Apr 2013 14:11:31 GMT


content-length: 223


content-type: application/xml


location: https://api.att.com/locker/v1/albums/735




<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>


<album>


    <count>0</count>


    <creationDate>Wed, 04 May 2013 14:43:03 GMT</creationDate>


    <description>Old School</description>


    <id>735</id>


    <name>somealbum</name>


    <previews/>


    <size>0</size>


</album>

3.2.7.2 Response – Example (JSON)

This shows the response to an album creation in JSON format
HTTP/1.1 201 Created


date: Wed, 27 Apr 2013 14:11:31 GMT


content-length: 223


content-type: application/json


location: https://api.att.com/locker/v1/albums/735




{


  "album": {


    "count": 0,


    "creationDate": "Wed, 04 May 2013 14:43:03 GMT",


    "description": "Old School",


    "id": 735,


    "name": "somealbum",


    "size": 0


  }


}

3.2.8 HTTP Response Codes

List expected response codes (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
Code
Reason Phrase
Description
201
Created
Successful response and resource was successfully created.
400
Bad Request
Many possible reasons not specified by the other codes.
401
Authentication Error
Authentication failed or was not provided.
403
Forbidden
Access permission error.
404
Not Found
The server has not found anything matching the Request-URI. No indication is given of whether the condition is temporary or permanent.
405
Method Not Allowed
A request was made of a resource using a request method not supported by that resource (e.g., using PUT on a REST resource that only supports POST).
408
Request Timeout
The client did not produce a request within the time that the server was prepared to wait. The client MAY repeat the request without modifications at any later time.
411
Length Required
The Content-Length header was not specified.
413
Request Entity Too Large
The size of the request body exceed the maximum size permitted.
415
Unsupported Media Type
The request is in a format not supported by the requested resource for the requested method.
500
Internal Server Error
The server encountered an internal error or timed out; please retry.
503
Service Unavailable
The server is currently unable to receive requests; please retry.

3.2.9 Service Exceptions

List the service exceptions generated by the operation (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
MessageId
Text
Variables
Parent HTTP Code
SVC0001
A service error has occurred. Error is <Error Explanation>
Error Explanation : <content here>
400
SVC0002
Invalid input value for Message part 'name'. Album name already exists
Error Explanation : <content here>
400
SVC0002
Invalid input value for Message part <part name>
part name : name of the input parameter that resulted in the error
400

MessageId
Text
Variables
Parent HTTP Code
POL0001
A policy error occurred. For example, rate limit error, authentication and authorization error.
N/A
401,403
POL0001
User account has reached system safe defaults
N/A
403
POL1009
User has not been provisioned for %1
System that hasn’t been provisioned
403

3.3 Operation: Get Album Listing

3.3.1 Functional Behavior

Describe the functional behavior provided by this operation. Also add here any special considerations, assumptions, and dependencies for this particular operation
Get the list of albums for a user.

3.3.2 Call flow

Insert below a sequence diagram (ping pong) diagram in context to a complete call flow or transaction with numbered arrows and some description explaining the sequence as appropriate.

3.3.3 Version Impact Summary

Summarize the different versions of this operation that are in production or deleted by the current release of this service.

3.3.4 Authentication and Authorization

Describe OAuth model applicable to this operation.
Authorization Model
Subscriber Authorization required?
OAuth Scope Value
Brief Description
OAuth
authorization_code
Yes
LOCKER
  1. Redirect user to AT&T authorization page to capture User consent
  2. Obtain Token obtained using authorization code issued by the gateway alonf the client key and secret by making an Oauth token call with GrantType=authorization_code

In the table below, describe supported representation formats for the request and response body. Where different versions support different formats, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table.

3.3.6 Input Parameters

In the table below, describe input parameters. Where different versions support different input parameters, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table. The allowed values for the Location in Request column are: Header, Resource URI, Body or Query Parameter.
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
accept
String
No
Specifies the format of the body of the response. Valid values are:
  • application/json
  • application/xml
The default value is application/json. Per rfc2616: "If no Accept header field is present, then it is assumed that the client accepts all media types." By default our services return application/json.
Normal Accept header processing rules shall be followed according to rfc2616.
Note: If there is no entity body in a normal successful response, this parameter can still be specified to determine the format in the case of an error response message.
Header
accept-encoding
String
No
Specifies the accept encoding format. When this header is present, the gateway should compress the response to indicate the client that response is in compressed format. Valid values are: gzip
Header
authorization
String
Yes
Specifies the authorization type and token. "Bearer" + OAuth Token – access_token. If the authorization header is missing, the system shall return an HTTP 400 Invalid Request message. If the token is invalid the system shall return an HTTP 401 Unauthorized message with a WWW-Authenticate HTTP header.
Header
limit
Changed “required” to Yes to align with IAM
Integer
Yes
Specifies the max number of results returned.
Made it required, so no more default
Query Parameter
offset
Changed to “offset” from “marker” to align with IAM
Integer
Yes
Specifies the scroll set pointer on the results collection.
Query Parameter
orderBy
String
No
Specifies the sorting criteria. The valid values for sort are: name, creationDate, size, count
Can there be multiple?
Default: name
Query Parameter
order
String
No
The sorting order. The valid values are: asc, desc
Default: asc
how was this spec'ed in other APIs???
Query Parameter

3.3.6.1 Request – Example (Get albums based on query parameters)

This demonstrates how to get albums using GET, and specifying the response to be in XML.
GET /locker/v1/albums?limit=100&offset=15&orderBy=name&order=asc HTTP/1.1 


host: api.att.com


authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678


accept: application/xml

3.3.7.1 Response – Example (XML)

This shows the response to a Get All Albums request in XML format.
HTTP/1.1 200 OK


date: Wed, 27 Apr 2011 14:11:31 GMT


content-length: 223


content-type: application/xml




<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>


<albums>


    <album>


        <count>0</count>


        <creationDate>Tue, 03 May 2011 21:47:54 GMT</creationDate>


        <description></description>


        <id>717</id>


        <name>MY FIRST ALBUM</name>


        <previews/>


        <size>0</size>


    </album>


    <album>


        <count>0</count>


        <creationDate>Tue, 03 May 2011 21:48:18 GMT</creationDate>


        <description></description>


        <id>718</id>


        <name>MY FIRST ALBUM</name>


        <previews/>


        <size>0</size>


    </album>


    <count>2</count>


    <total>2</total>


</albums>

3.3.7.2 Response – Example (JSON)

This shows the response to a Get All albums in JSON format.
HTTP/1.1 200 OK 


content-type: application/json 


content-length: 624 


date: Thu, 04 Jun 2010 02:51:59 GMT




{


  "albums": {


    "album": [


      {


        "count": 0,


        "creationDate": "Tue, 03 May 2011 21:47:54 GMT",


        "id": 717,


        "name": "MY FIRST ALBUM",


        "size": 0


      },


      {


        "count": 0,


        "creationDate": "Tue, 03 May 2011 21:48:18 GMT",


        "id": 718,


        "name": "MY FIRST ALBUM",


        "size": 0


      }


    ],


    "count": 2,


    "total": 2


  }


}

3.3.8 HTTP Response Codes

List expected response codes (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
Code
Reason Phrase
Description
200
OK
Successful response
400
Bad Request
Many possible reasons not specified by the other codes.
401
Authentication Error
Authentication failed or was not provided.
403
Forbidden
Access permission error.
404
Not Found
The server has not found anything matching the Request-URI. No indication is given of whether the condition is temporary or permanent.
405
Method Not Allowed
A request was made of a resource using a request method not supported by that resource (e.g., using PUT on a REST resource that only supports POST).
408
Request Timeout
The client did not produce a request within the time that the server was prepared to wait. The client MAY repeat the request without modifications at any later time.
411
Length Required
The Content-Length header was not specified.
414
Request-URI Too Long
The server is refusing to service the request because the Request-URI is longer than the server is willing to interpret.
415
Unsupported Media Type
The request is in a format not supported by the requested resource for the requested method.
500
Internal Server Error
The server encountered an internal error or timed out; please retry.
503
Service Unavailable
The server is currently unable to receive requests; please retry.

Error Explanation : <content here>
400
SVC0002
Invalid input value for Message part <part name>
part name : name of the input parameter that resulted in the error
400
SVC0002
Invalid input value for Message part offset. The offset must be greater than or equal to zero and less than the total number of objects
N/A
400
SVC0003
Invalid input value for Message part <part name>, valid values are <part values>
part value : value of input parameter that was found to be in error.

3.4 Operation: Delete Album

3.4.1 Functional Behavior

Describe the functional behavior provided by this operation. Also add here any special considerations, assumptions, and dependencies for this particular operation
Delete an album for a user.

3.4.2 Call flow

Insert below a sequence diagram (ping pong) diagram in context to a complete call flow or transaction with numbered arrows and some description explaining the sequence as appropriate.

Summarize the different versions of this operation that are in production or deleted by the current release of this service.

Subscriber Authorization required?
OAuth Scope Value

  2. Obtain Token obtained using authorization code issued by the gateway alonf the client key and secret by making an Oauth token call with GrantType=authorization_code

albumId

3.4.6.1 Request – Example (Delete an album)

This demonstrates how to Delete a particularalbum.
DELETE /locker/v1/albums/4322132 HTTP/1.1 


host: api.att.com


authorization: Bearer 38C2399A23999


accept: application/xml

3.4.7 Output Parameters

In the table below, describe output parameters. Where different versions support different output parameters, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table. Note: ‘consent’ refers to end user consent which may need to be obtained before data is returned,

Data Type
Req?
Brief description

string

  • application/xml
  • application/json

string
No

Header

3.4.7.1 Response – Example (Delete Album response)

This shows a successful response to Delete album request.
HTTP/1.1 204 No Content


content-length: 0


date: Thu, 04 Jun 2010 02:51:59 GMT

3.4.8 HTTP Response Codes

List expected response codes (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
Code
Reason Phrase
Description
204
No Content
Successful response and the response does not include an entity.
400
Bad Request
Many possible reasons not specified by the other codes.
401
Authentication Error
Authentication failed or was not provided.
403
Forbidden
Access permission error.
404
Not Found
The server has not found anything matching the Request-URI. No indication is given of whether the condition is temporary or permanent.
If the AlbumId is incorrect, then the resource does not exist, so a 404 shall be thrown.
408
Request Timeout
The client did not produce a request within the time that the server was prepared to wait. The client MAY repeat the request without modifications at any later time.
500
Internal Server Error
The server encountered an internal error or timed out; please retry.
503
Service Unavailable
The server is currently unable to receive requests; please retry.

3.4.9 Service Exceptions

Text
Variables
Parent HTTP Code

Error Explanation : <content here>
400
SVC0002
Invalid input value for Message part <part name>
part name : name of the input parameter that resulted in the error
400

3.4.10 Policy Exceptions

List the policy exceptions generated by the operation (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
MessageId
Text
Variables
Parent HTTP Code
POL0001
A policy error occurred. For example, rate limit error, authentication and authorization error.
N/A
401,403
POL1009
User has not been provisioned for %1
System that hasn’t been provisioned
403

3.5 Operation: Update Album

3.5.1 Functional Behavior

Describe the functional behavior provided by this operation. Also add here any special considerations, assumptions, and dependencies for this particular operation
Modifies the information of a specific album belonging to the specified user. If a user attempts to update a album instance with name of an already existing album instance, service will throw an exception.

3.5.2 Call flow

Insert below a sequence diagram (ping pong) diagram in context to a complete call flow or transaction with numbered arrows and some description explaining the sequence as appropriate.

3.5.3 Version Impact Summary

Summarize the different versions of this operation that are in production or deleted by the current release of this service.
Service Version
Major or Minor Impact
Changes Introduced by this Version
1
Major
Initial Release

3.5.4 Authentication and Authorization

Describe OAuth model applicable to this operation.
Authorization Model
Subscriber Authorization required?
OAuth Scope Value
Brief Description
OAuth
authorization_code
Yes
LOCKER
  1. Redirect user to AT&T authorization page to capture User consent
  2. Obtain Token obtained using authorization code issued by the gateway alonf the client key and secret by making an Oauth token call with GrantType=authorization_code

3.5.5 Representation Formats

In the table below, describe supported representation formats for the request and response body. Where different versions support different formats, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table.
Direction
Supported Representation Formats
Request
XML, JSON
Response
XML, JSON

3.5.6 Input Parameters

In the table below, describe input parameters. Where different versions support different input parameters, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table. The allowed values for the Location in Request column are: Header, Resource URI, Body or Query Parameter.
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
accept
String
No
Specifies the format of the body of the response. Valid values are:
  • application/json
  • application/xml
The default value is application/json. Per rfc2616: "If no Accept header field is present, then it is assumed that the client accepts all media types." By default our services return application/json.
Normal Accept header processing rules shall be followed according to rfc2616.
Note: If there is no entity body in a normal successful response, this parameter can still be specified to determine the format in the case of an error response message.
Header
accept-encoding
String
No
Specifies the accept encoding format. When this header is present, the gateway should compress the response to indicate the client that response is in compressed format. Valid values are: gzip
Header
authorization
String
Yes
Specifies the authorization type and token. "Bearer" + OAuth Token – access_token. If the authorization header is missing, the system shall return an HTTP 400 Invalid Request message. If the token is invalid the system shall return an HTTP 401 Unauthorized message with a WWW-Authenticate HTTP header.
Header
content-length
Integer
No
Specifies the length of the content in octets. This header parameter is only required for the non-streaming request.
Header
content-type
String
Yes
Specifies the type of content of the body of the entity. Must be set to one of the following values:
  • application/json
  • application/xml
Header
albumId
Integer
Yes
Specifies id of the album that is being updated
URI Path
album
Object
Yes
Specifies the object that contains the album information
Body
name
String
No
Specifies the name of the album
Body
description
String
No
Specifies the description of the album
Body
reorder
Object
No
Contains the reorder information
Body

Reorder Object

This table specifies the parameters that belong to the reorder object.
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
indexes
rename???
are these Integers or Strings??
Array
Yes
Specifies the indexes of the files that need to move.
body
after
rename???
are these Integers or Strings??
Integer
Yes
Specifies the index where the files should be moved after.
body

3.5.6.1 Request – Example (Update a album - XML)

This demonstrates how to update a album, and specifying the response to be in XML.
PATCH /locker/v1/albums/3223232 HTTP/1.1 


host: api.att.com


content-type: application/xml


authorization: Bearer 38C2399A23999


accept: application/xml




<album>


      <name>rename album</name>


      <description>rename album description</description>


      <reorder>


          <indexes>1</indexes>


          <after>1</after>


      </reorder>


</album>

3.5.6.2 Request – Example (Update a album - JSON)

This demonstrates how to update a album, the response format will be in JSON.
PATCH /locker/v1/albums/3223232 HTTP/1.1 


host: api.att.com


content-type: application/json


authorization: Bearer 38C2399A23999


accept: application/json




{


  "album": {


    "name": "rename album",


    "description": "rename album description",


    "reorder": {


      "indexes": 1,


      "after": 1


    }


  }


}

3.5.7.1 Response – Example (Update album - XML)

This shows the response to a Update album in XML format.
HTTP/1.1 200 OK


date: Wed, 27 Apr 2011 14:11:31 GMT


content-length: 223


content-type: application/xml




<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>


<album>


    <count>0</count>


    <creationDate>05-05-2011 14:17:27 +0000</creationDate>


    <description>rename album description</description>


    <id>856</id>


    <name>rename album</name>


    <size>0</size>


</album>

3.5.7.2 Response – Example (Update album - JSON)

This shows the response to a Update album in JSON format
HTTP/1.1 200 OK


date: Wed, 27 Apr 2011 14:11:31 GMT


content-length: 223


content-type: application/json




{


    "album": {


      "count": 0,


      "creationDate": "05-05-2011 14:17:27 +0000",


      "name": "rename album",


      "description": "rename album description",


      "id": 856,


      "size": 0


    }


}

3.5.8 HTTP Response Codes

List expected response codes (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
Code
Reason Phrase
Description
200
OK
Successful response
400
Bad Request
Many possible reasons not specified by the other codes.
401
Authentication Error
Authentication failed or was not provided.
403
Forbidden
Access permission error.
404
Not Found
The server has not found anything matching the Request-URI. No indication is given of whether the condition is temporary or permanent.
408
Request Timeout
The client did not produce a request within the time that the server was prepared to wait. The client MAY repeat the request without modifications at any later time.
411
Length Required
The Content-Length header was not specified.
413
Request Entity Too Large
The size of the request body exceed the maximum size permitted.
414
Request-URI Too Long
The server is refusing to service the request because the Request-URI is longer than the server is willing to interpret.
415
Unsupported Media Type
The request is in a format not supported by the requested resource for the requested method.
500
Internal Server Error
The server encountered an internal error or timed out; please retry.
503
Service Unavailable
The server is currently unable to receive requests; please retry.

3.5.9 Service Exceptions

List the service exceptions generated by the operation (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
MessageId
Text
Variables
Parent HTTP Code
SVC0001
A service error has occurred. Error code is <Error Explanation>
Error Explanation : <content here>
400
SVC0002
Invalid input value for Message part <part name>
part name : name of the input parameter that resulted in the error
400
SVC0003
Invalid input value for Message part <part name>, valid values are <part values>
part value : value of input parameter that was found to be in error.
400

3.5.10 Policy Exceptions

List the policy exceptions generated by the operation (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
MessageId
Text
Variables
Parent HTTP Code
POL0001
A policy error occurred. For example, rate limit error, authentication and authorization error.
N/A
401,403
POL1009
User has not been provisioned for %1
System that hasn’t been provisioned
403

3.6 Operation: Get Album Contents

3.6.1 Functional Behavior

Describe the functional behavior provided by this operation. Also add here any special considerations, assumptions, and dependencies for this particular operation
Get the entries of a album belonging to the specific user.

3.6.2 Call flow

Insert below a sequence diagram (ping pong) diagram in context to a complete call flow or transaction with numbered arrows and some description explaining the sequence as appropriate.

3.6.3 Version Impact Summary

Summarize the different versions of this operation that are in production or deleted by the current release of this service.
Service Version
Major or Minor Impact
Changes Introduced by this Version
1
Major
Initial Release

3.6.4 Authentication and Authorization

Describe OAuth model applicable to this operation.
Authorization Model
Subscriber Authorization required?
OAuth Scope Value
Brief Description
OAuth
authorization_code
Yes
LOCKER
  1. Redirect user to AT&T authorization page to capture User consent
  2. Obtain Token obtained using authorization code issued by the gateway alonf the client key and secret by making an Oauth token call with GrantType=authorization_code

3.6.5 Representation Formats

In the table below, describe supported representation formats for the request and response body. Where different versions support different formats, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table.
Direction
Supported Respresentation Formats
Request
N/A
Response
XML, JSON

3.6.6 Input Parameters

In the table below, describe input parameters. Where different versions support different input parameters, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table. The allowed values for the Location in Request column are: Header, Resource URI, Body or Query Parameter.
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
accept
String
No
Specifies the format of the body of the response. Valid values are:
  • application/json
  • application/xml
The default value is application/json. Per rfc2616: "If no Accept header field is present, then it is assumed that the client accepts all media types." By default our services return application/json.
Normal Accept header processing rules shall be followed according to rfc2616.
Note: If there is no entity body in a normal successful response, this parameter is still needed to specify the format in the case of an error response message.
Header
accept-encoding
String
No
Specifies the accept encoding format. When this header is present, the gateway should compress the response to indicate the client that response is in compressed format. Valid values are: gzip
Header
authorization
String
Yes
Specifies the authorization type and token. "Bearer" + OAuth Token – access_token. If the authorization header is missing, the system shall return an HTTP 400 Invalid Request message. If the token is invalid the system shall return an HTTP 401 Unauthorized message with a WWW-Authenticate HTTP header.
Header
albumId
Integer
Yes
Specifies the album that is being accessed
URI Path
limit
Integer
Yes
Specifies the max number of results returned.
Query Parameter
offset
Integer
Yes
Specifies the scroll set pointer on the results collection.
Query Parameter
orderBy
String
No
Specifies the sorting criteria. Constraints: name, creationdate, size, count
Default: name
Query Parameter
order
String
No
Specifies the sorting order. Constraints: asc, desc
Default: asc
how was this spec'ed in other APIs???
Query Parameter
filter
String
No
Specifies how to filter the results. Valid values are: picture, video, all
Default: All
Query Parameter

3.6.6.1 Request – Example (Get album listing)

This demonstrates how to get album contents using GET with query parameters, and specifying the response to be in JSON.
GET /locker/v1/albums/22323232?limit=20&offset=10&filter=all&order=asc HTTP/1.1 


host: api.att.com


authorization: Bearer 38C2399A23999


accept: application/json


accept-encoding: gzip

body

3.6.7.1 Response – Example (album Content Listing in XML)

This shows the response to a Get content listing request in XML format.
HTTP/1.1 200 OK


content-type: application/xml 


content-length: 539


date: Thu, 04 Jun 2010 02:51:59 GMT




<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>


<content>


    <count>1</count>


    <mediaList>


        <media>


            <accessBlocked>false</accessBlocked>


            <albums>


                <album>


                    <count>1</count>


                    <creationDate>Wed, 27 Apr 2011 17:34:33 GMT</creationDate>


                    <description>rename album descriptionl</description>


                    <id>157</id>


                    <name>rename album</name>


                    <previews>


                        <preview>


                            <format>jpg</format>


                            <height>240</height>


                            <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=54&amp;ticket=708eab48-b225-427b-a252-c2bbe520cefa&amp;preview=320x240xjpg</url>


                            <width>320</width>


                        </preview>


                        <preview>


                            <format>jpg</format>


                            <height>90</height>


                            <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=54&amp;ticket=708eab48-b225-427b-a252-c2bbe520cefa&amp;preview=120x90xjpg</url>


                            <width>120</width>


                        </preview>


                        <preview>


                            <format>jpg</format>


                            <height>480</height>


                            <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=54&amp;ticket=708eab48-b225-427b-a252-c2bbe520cefa&amp;preview=640x480xjpg</url>


                            <width>640</width>


                        </preview>


                    </previews>


                    <size>21564</size>


                </album>


            </albums>


            <av>


                <status>ok</status>


            </av>


            <contentSize>21564</contentSize>


            <creationDate>Mon, 25 Apr 2011 22:31:19 GMT</creationDate>


            <description>UPDATING DESCRIPTION</description>


            <extension>jpg</extension>


            <format>jpeg; charset=binary</format>


            <id>54</id>


            <metadataList>


                <metadata>


                    <name>ColorSpace</name>


                    <value>RGB</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>Compression</name>


                    <value>JPEG</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>Dimension</name>


                    <value>640x422</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>Geometry</name>


                    <value>raster</value>


                </metadata>


            </metadataList>


            <name>epic diving fail.jpg</name>


            <previews>


                <preview>


                    <format>jpg</format>


                    <height>240</height>


                    <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=54&amp;ticket=708eab48-b225-427b-a252-c2bbe520cefa&amp;preview=320x240xjpg</url>


                    <width>320</width>


                </preview>


                <preview>


                    <format>jpg</format>


                    <height>90</height>


                    <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=54&amp;ticket=708eab48-b225-427b-a252-c2bbe520cefa&amp;preview=120x90xjpg</url>


                    <width>120</width>


                </preview>


                <preview>


                    <format>jpg</format>


                    <height>480</height>


                    <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=54&amp;ticket=708eab48-b225-427b-a252-c2bbe520cefa&amp;preview=640x480xjpg</url>


                    <width>640</width>


                </preview>


            </previews>


            <shareCodes/>


            <sharingBlocked>false</sharingBlocked>


            <tags/>


            <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=54&amp;ticket=708eab48-b225-427b-a252-c2bbe520cefa</url>


        </media>


    </mediaList>


    <total>1</total>


</content>

3.6.7.2 Response – Example (album Content Listing in JSON)

This shows the response to a profile creation in JSON format
HTTP/1.1 200 OK 


content-type: application/json 


content-length: 624 


date: Thu, 04 Jun 2010 02:51:59 GMT




{


  "content": {


    "count": 1,


    "mediaList": {


      "media": {


        "accessBlocked": false,


        "albums": {


          "album": {


            "count": 1,


            "creationDate": "Wed, 27 Apr 2011 17:34:33 GMT",


            "description": "rename album descriptionl",


            "id": 157,


            "name": "rename album",


            "previews": {


              "preview": [


                {


                  "format": "jpg",


                  "height": 240,


                  "url": "https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=54&ticket=708eab48-b225-427b-a252-c2bbe520cefa&preview=320x240xjpg",


                  "width": "320"


                },


                {


                  "format": "jpg",


                  "height": 90,


                  "url": "https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=54&ticket=708eab48-b225-427b-a252-c2bbe520cefa&preview=120x90xjpg",


                  "width": 120


                },


                {


                  "format": "jpg",


                  "height": 480,


                  "url": "https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=54&ticket=708eab48-b225-427b-a252-c2bbe520cefa&preview=640x480xjpg",


                  "width": 640


                }


              ]


            },


            "size": 21564


          }


        },


        "av": { "status": "ok" },


        "contentSize": 21564,


        "creationDate": "Mon, 25 Apr 2011 22:31:19 GMT",


        "description": "UPDATING DESCRIPTION",


        "extension": "jpg",


        "format": "jpeg; charset=binary",


        "id": 54,


        "metadataList": {


          "metadata": [


            {


              "name": "ColorSpace",


              "value": "RGB"


            },


            {


              "name": "Compression",


              "value": "JPEG"


            },


            {


              "name": "Dimension",


              "value": "640x422"


            },


            {


              "name": "Geometry",


              "value": "raster"


            }


          ]


        },


        "name": "epic diving fail.jpg",


        "previews": {


          "preview": [


            {


              "format": "jpg",


              "height": 240,


              "url": "https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=54&ticket=708eab48-b225-427b-a252-c2bbe520cefa&preview=320x240xjpg",


              "width": "320"


            },


            {


              "format": "jpg",


              "height": 90,


              "url": "https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=54&ticket=708eab48-b225-427b-a252-c2bbe520cefa&preview=120x90xjpg",


              "width": 120


            },


            {


              "format": "jpg",


              "height": 480,


              "url": "https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=54&ticket=708eab48-b225-427b-a252-c2bbe520cefa&preview=640x480xjpg",


              "width": 640


            }


          ]


        },


        "sharingBlocked": false,


        "url": "https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=54&ticket=708eab48-b225-427b-a252-c2bbe520cefa"


      }


    },


    "total": 1


  }


}

3.6.8 HTTP Response Codes

List expected response codes (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
Code
Reason Phrase
Description
200
OK
Successful response
400
Bad Request
Many possible reasons not specified by the other codes.
401
Authentication Error
Authentication failed or was not provided.
403
Forbidden
Access permission error.
404
Not Found
The server has not found anything matching the Request-URI. No indication is given of whether the condition is temporary or permanent.
414
Request-URI Too Long
The server is refusing to service the request because the Request-URI is longer than the server is willing to interpret.
500
Internal Server Error
The server encountered an internal error or timed out; please retry.
503
Service Unavailable
The server is currently unable to receive requests; please retry.

3.6.9 Service Exceptions

List the service exceptions generated by the operation (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
MessageId
Text
Variables
Parent HTTP Code
SVC0001
A service error has occurred. Error code is <Error Explanation>
Error Explanation : <content here>
400
SVC0002
Invalid input value for Message part <part name>
part name : name of the input parameter that resulted in the error
400
SVC0002
Invalid input value for Message part offset. The offset must be greater than or equal to zero and less than the total number of objects
N/A
400
SVC0003
Invalid input value for Message part <part name>, valid values are <part values>
part value : value of input parameter that was found to be in error.
400

3.6.10 Policy Exceptions

List the policy exceptions generated by the operation (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
MessageId
Text
Variables
Parent HTTP Code
POL0001
A policy error occurred. For example, rate limit error, authentication and authorization error.
N/A
401,403
POL0001
Submitted limit is greater than the maximum allowed limit size or less than or equal to zero
N/A
403
POL1009
User has not been provisioned for %1
System that hasn’t been provisioned
403

3.7 Operation: Add Media to Album

3.7.1 Functional Behavior

Describe the functional behavior provided by this operation. Also add here any special considerations, assumptions, and dependencies for this particular operation
Insert a media object or a collection of media objects into an album belonging to a user. Add the same Media twice in the same album is allowed. Considering the following scenario: An album “Antarctica” contains Photo1.jpg
If a user selects 3 pictures, Photo1.jpg, Photo2.jpg, Photo3.jpg and adds them to the album “Antarctica”. Album “Antarctica” will contain, the following: Photo1.jpg, Photo1.jpg, Photo2.jpg and Photo3.jpg.

3.7.2 Call flow

Insert below a sequence diagram (ping pong) diagram in context to a complete call flow or transaction with numbered arrows and some description explaining the sequence as appropriate.

3.7.3 Version Impact Summary

Summarize the different versions of this operation that are in production or deleted by the current release of this service.
Service Version
Major or Minor Impact
Changes Introduced by this Version
1
Major
Initial Release

3.7.4 Authentication and Authorization

Describe OAuth model applicable to this operation.
Authorization Model
Subscriber Authorization required?
OAuth Scope Value
Brief Description
OAuth
authorization_code
Yes
LOCKER
  1. Redirect user to AT&T authorization page to capture User consent
  2. Obtain Token obtained using authorization code issued by the gateway alonf the client key and secret by making an Oauth token call with GrantType=authorization_code

3.7.5 Representation Formats

In the table below, describe supported representation formats for the request and response body. Where different versions support different formats, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table.
Direction
Supported Respresentation Formats
Request
XML, JSON
Response
XML, JSON

3.7.6 Input Parameters

In the table below, describe input parameters. Where different versions support different input parameters, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table. The allowed values for the Location in Request column are: Header, Resource URI, Body or Query Parameter.
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
accept
String
No
Specifies the format of the body of the response. Valid values are:
  • application/json
  • application/xml
The default value is application/json. Per rfc2616: "If no Accept header field is present, then it is assumed that the client accepts all media types." By default our services return application/json.
Normal Accept header processing rules shall be followed according to rfc2616.
Note: If there is no entity body in a normal successful response, this parameter can still be specified to determine the format in the case of an error response message.
Header
accept-encoding
String
No
Specifies the accept encoding format. When this header is present, the gateway should compress the response to indicate the client that response is in compressed format. Valid values are: gzip
Header
authorization
String
Yes
Specifies the authorization type and token. "Bearer" + OAuth Token – access_token. If the authorization header is missing, the system shall return an HTTP 400 Invalid Request message. If the token is invalid the system shall return an HTTP 401 Unauthorized message with a WWW-Authenticate HTTP header.
Header
content-length
Integer
No
Specifies the length of the content in octets. This header parameter is only required for the non-streaming request.
Header
content-type
String
Yes
Specifies the type of content of the body of the entity. Must be set to one of the following values:
  • application/json
  • application/xml
Header
albumId
Integer
Yes
Specifies the id of the album where the files will be placed.
URI Path
mediaIds
Object
Yes
Contains the media information
Body
id
Array
Yes
Specifies the ids of the content that are to be added to the album.
Body
index
Integer
No
Specifies the absolute position where you want to place the new content.
Body

3.7.6.1 Request – Example (Add media to an album in XML)

This demonstrates how to add media to an album, and specifying the request to be in XML.
POST /locker/v1/albums/3433435/media HTTP/1.1 


host: api.att.com


content-type: application/xml


authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678


accept: application/xml




<mediaIds>


    <id>112</id>


    <id>125</id>


    <index>1</index>  	


</mediaIds>

3.7.6.2 Request – Example (Add media to an album in JSON)

This demonstrates how to add media to an album, and specifying the request to be in JSON.
POST /locker/v1/folders/3433435/files HTTP/1.1 


Host: api.att.com


content-type: application/json


authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678


accept: application/json




{


  "mediaIds": {


    "id": [112,125],


    "index": 1


  }


}

3.7.7 Output Parameters

In the table below, describe output parameters. Where different versions support different output parameters, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table. Note: ‘consent’ refers to end user consent which may need to be obtained before data is returned,
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
content-type
string
yes
Specifies the type of content of the body of the entity. Must be set to one of the following values:
  • application/json
  • aplication/xml
Note: If there is no entity body in a normal successful response, this parameter is still needed to specify the format in the case of an error response message.
Header

3.7.7.1 Response – Example (Add media to an album in XML)

This shows the response to a an add file to folder request.
HTTP/1.1 204 No Content


date: Thu, 04 Jun 2010 02:51:59 GMT

3.7.8 HTTP Response Codes

List expected response codes (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
Code
Reason Phrase
Description
204
No Content
Successful response and the response does not include an entity.
400
Bad Request
Many possible reasons not specified by the other codes.
401
Authentication Error
Authentication failed or was not provided.
403
Forbidden
Access permission error.
404
Not Found
The server has not found anything matching the Request-URI. No indication is given of whether the condition is temporary or permanent.
405
Method Not Allowed
A request was made of a resource using a request method not supported by that resource (e.g., using PUT on a REST resource that only supports POST).
408
Request Timeout
The client did not produce a request within the time that the server was prepared to wait. The client MAY repeat the request without modifications at any later time.
411
Length Required
The Content-Length header was not specified.
413
Request Entity Too Large
The size of the request body exceed the maximum size permitted.
415
Unsupported Media Type
The request is in a format not supported by the requested resource for the requested method.
500
Internal Server Error
The server encountered an internal error or timed out; please retry.
503
Service Unavailable
The server is currently unable to receive requests; please retry.

3.7.9 Service Exceptions

List the service exceptions generated by the operation (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
MessageId
Text
Variables
Parent HTTP Code
SVC0001
A service error has occurred. Error code is <Error Explanation>
Error Explanation : <content here>
400
SVC0002
Invalid input value for Message part <part name>
part name : name of the input parameter that resulted in the error
400

N/A

3.8 Operation: Get Media Listing

3.8.1 Functional Behavior

Describe the functional behavior provided by this operation. Also add here any special considerations, assumptions, and dependencies for this particular operation
Lists all media belonging to a user.

3.8.2 Call flow

Insert below a sequence diagram (ping pong) diagram in context to a complete call flow or transaction with numbered arrows and some description explaining the sequence as appropriate.

3.8.3 Version Impact Summary

Summarize the different versions of this operation that are in production or deleted by the current release of this service.
Service Version
Major or Minor Impact
Changes Introduced by this Version
1
Major
Initial Release

3.8.4 Authentication and Authorization

Describe OAuth model applicable to this operation.
Authorization Model
Subscriber Authorization required?
OAuth Scope Value
Brief Description
OAuth
authorization_code
Yes
LOCKER
  1. Redirect user to AT&T authorization page to capture User consent
  2. Obtain Token obtained using authorization code issued by the gateway alonf the client key and secret by making an Oauth token call with GrantType=authorization_code

3.8.5 Representation Formats

In the table below, describe supported representation formats for the request and response body. Where different versions support different formats, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table.
Direction
Supported Respresentation Formats
Request
N/A
Response
XML, JSON

3.8.6 Input Parameters

In the table below, describe input parameters. Where different versions support different input parameters, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table. The allowed values for the Location in Request column are: Header, Resource URI, Body or Query Parameter.
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
accept
String
No
Specifies the format of the body of the response. Valid values are:
  • application/json
  • application/xml
The default value is application/json. Per rfc2616: "If no Accept header field is present, then it is assumed that the client accepts all media types." By default our services return application/json.
Normal Accept header processing rules shall be followed according to rfc2616.
Note: If there is no entity body in a normal successful response, this parameter can still be specified to determine the format in the case of an error response message.
Header
accept-encoding
String
No
Specifies the accept encoding format. When this header is present, the gateway should compress the response to indicate the client that response is in compressed format. Valid values are: gzip
Header
authorization
String
Yes
Specifies the authorization type and token. "Bearer" + OAuth Token – access_token. If the authorization header is missing, the system shall return an HTTP 400 Invalid Request message. If the token is invalid the system shall return an HTTP 401 Unauthorized message with a WWW-Authenticate HTTP header.
Header
query
String
No
URL encoded search query. We recommend using the UTF-8 encoding scheme to obtain the bytes for unsafe characters. This is in keeping with the following W3 recommendation: http://www.w3.org/TR/html40/appendix/notes.html#non-ascii-chars
Query Parameter
before
String
No
Files added before or exactly at timestamp, if empty no lower time limit for search period, example: 2010-07-30
Query Parameter
after
String
No
Files added after or exactly at timestamp, if empty no lower time limit for search period, example: 2010-07-30
Query Parameter
limit
Integer
Yes
Specifies the max number of results returned.
Query Parameter
offset
Integer
Yes
Specifies the scroll set pointer on the results collection.
Query Parameter
orderBy
String
No
Specifies the sorting criteria. Constraints: name, creationdate, contentsize, author
Default: name
Query Parameter
order
String
No
Specifies the sorting order. Constraints: asc, desc
Default: asc
Query Parameter
filter
String
No
Specifies how to filter the results. Valid values are: picture, video, all
Default: All
Query Parameter
isCompressed
Boolean
No
Specifies that the result set will only contain the name of the media instead of the full details if set to true. Otherwise default result set.
Query Parameter

3.8.6.1 Request – Example (Get a media listing)

This demonstrates how to get a media listing.
GET /locker/v1/media?limit=20&offset=10&orderBy=author&order=desc&filter=all HTTP/1.1 


Host: api.att.com


authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678


accept: application/xml


accept-encoding: gzip

Parameter

Req?
Brief description

yes

  • applciation/json
  • application/xml

string

This is not in the SB param table

yes

yes

should we get rid of this container?

String

Req?
Brief description

No

String
No

body

3.8.7.1 Response – Example (Get media listing in XML)

This shows the response to a Get media listing in XML format.
HTTP/1.1 200 OK


content-type: application/xml 


content-length: 929 


date: Thu, 04 Jun 2010 02:51:59 GMT




<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>


<content>


    <count>4</count>


    <mediaList>


        <media>


            <accessBlocked>false</accessBlocked>


            <collections/>


            <av>


                <status>ok</status>


            </av>


            <contentSize>88376</contentSize>


            <creationDate>01-01-2013 11:01:58 +0000</creationDate>


            <description>Whoa i'm hungry!</description>


            <extension>jpg</extension>


            <format>jpeg; charset=binary</format>


            <id>176</id>


            <metadataList>


                <metadata>


                    <name>ColorDepth</name>


                    <value>24</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>ColorSpace</name>


                    <value>Uncalibrated</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>Compression</name>


                    <value>JPEG</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>Dimension</name>


                    <value>356x283</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>Geometry</name>


                    <value>raster</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>Orientation</name>


                    <value>1</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>Resolution</name>


                    <value>72x72dpi</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>Software</name>


                    <value>Adobe Photoshop CS5 Windows</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>Year</name>


                    <value>2010</value>


                </metadata>


            </metadataList>


            <name>23.jpg</name>


            <previews>


                <preview>


                    <format>jpg</format>


                    <height>240</height>


                    <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=176&amp;ticket=ae4c5a25-a1d7-4f14-a292-c9ad64aee4f0&amp;preview=320x240xjpg</url>


                    <width>320</width>


                </preview>


                <preview>


                    <format>jpg</format>


                    <height>90</height>


                    <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=176&amp;ticket=ae4c5a25-a1d7-4f14-a292-c9ad64aee4f0&amp;preview=120x90xjpg</url>


                    <width>120</width>


                </preview>


                <preview>


                    <format>jpg</format>


                    <height>480</height>


                    <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=176&amp;ticket=ae4c5a25-a1d7-4f14-a292-c9ad64aee4f0&amp;preview=640x480xjpg</url>


                    <width>640</width>


                </preview>


            </previews>


            <shareCodes>


                <shareCode>a9fd0e52-51b6-4f8c-b25c-bbeb3f7cc4d6</shareCode>


                <shareCode>0e7264d8-1702-4ef7-9962-806573532135</shareCode>


                <shareCode>10ad5903-9d7d-4939-b011-ddb662f7f015</shareCode>


                <shareCode>c25eb52c-e4f6-4064-9c12-25573d1a2724</shareCode>


                <shareCode>2f4d84fa-0f45-4dc7-8536-147978172ef3</shareCode>


            </shareCodes>


            <sharingBlocked>false</sharingBlocked>


            <tags/>


            <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=176&amp;ticket=ae4c5a25-a1d7-4f14-a292-c9ad64aee4f0</url>


        </media>


        <media>


            <accessBlocked>false</accessBlocked>


            <collections/>


            <av>


                <status>ok</status>


            </av>


            <contentSize>2708955</contentSize>


            <creationDate>01-01-2013 11:01:58 +0000</creationDate>


            <description>Whoa i'm hungry!</description>


            <extension>mp4</extension>


            <format>mp4; charset=binary</format>


            <id>107</id>


            <metadataList>


                <metadata>


                    <name>AudioBitrate</name>


                    <value>109</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>Dimension</name>


                    <value>640x362</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>Drm</name>


                    <value>0</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>Duration</name>


                    <value>15.641</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>VideoBitrate</name>


                    <value>1256</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>VideoCodec</name>


                    <value>AVC</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>VideoFps</name>


                    <value>23.975999999999999</value>


                </metadata>


            </metadataList>


            <name>carSliding.mp4</name>


            <previews>


                <preview>


                    <format>jpg</format>


                    <height>240</height>


                    <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=107&amp;ticket=ae4c5a25-a1d7-4f14-a292-c9ad64aee4f0&amp;preview=320x240xjpg</url>


                    <width>320</width>


                </preview>


                <preview>


                    <format>jpg</format>


                    <height>90</height>


                    <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=107&amp;ticket=ae4c5a25-a1d7-4f14-a292-c9ad64aee4f0&amp;preview=120x90xjpg</url>


                    <width>120</width>


                </preview>


                <preview>


                    <format>jpg</format>


                    <height>480</height>


                    <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=107&amp;ticket=ae4c5a25-a1d7-4f14-a292-c9ad64aee4f0&amp;preview=640x480xjpg</url>


                    <width>640</width>


                </preview>


                <preview>


                    <format>3gp</format>


                    <height>100</height>


                    <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=107&amp;ticket=ae4c5a25-a1d7-4f14-a292-c9ad64aee4f0&amp;preview=176x100x3gp</url>


                    <width>176</width>


                </preview>


                <preview>


                    <format>3gp</format>


                    <height>180</height>

3.8.7.2 Response – Example (Get media listing in JSON)

This shows the response to a Get media listing in JSON format

content-length: 624

                "name": "Iso",


                "value": "100"


              },


              {


                "name": "Make",


                "value": "Canon"


              },


              {


                "name": "Model",


                "value": "Canon EOS 5D Mark II"


              },


              {


                "name": "Resolution",


                "value": "180x180"


              },


              {


                "name": "Shutter",


                "value": "32/10s"


              },


              {


                "name": "Year",


                "value": "2011"


              }


            ]


          },


          "name": "snowatlanta.jpg",


          "previews": {


            "preview": [


              {


                "format": "jpg",


                "height": 240,


                "url": "https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=108&ticket=ae4c5a25-a1d7-4f14-a292-c9ad64aee4f0&preview=320x240xjpg",


                "width": 320


              },


              {


                "format": "jpg",


                "height": 90,


                "url": "https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=108&ticket=ae4c5a25-a1d7-4f14-a292-c9ad64aee4f0&preview=120x90xjpg",


                "width": "120"


              },


              {


                "format": "jpg",


                "height": 480,


                "url": "https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=108&ticket=ae4c5a25-a1d7-4f14-a292-c9ad64aee4f0&preview=640x480xjpg",


                "width": 640


              }


            ]


          },


          "shareCodes": { "shareCode": "19cea442-57f2-4794-835c-97108d57175d" },


          "sharingBlocked": false,


          "url": "https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=108&ticket=ae4c5a25-a1d7-4f14-a292-c9ad64aee4f0"


        }


      ]


    },


    "total": 4


  }


}

3.8.8 HTTP Response Codes

List expected response codes (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
Code
Reason Phrase
Description
200
OK
Successful response
400
Bad Request
Many possible reasons not specified by the other codes.
401
Authentication Error
Authentication failed or was not provided.
403
Forbidden
Access permission error.
404
Not Found
The server has not found anything matching the Request-URI. No indication is given of whether the condition is temporary or permanent.
414
Request-URI Too Long
The server is refusing to service the request because the Request-URI is longer than the server is willing to interpret.
500
Internal Server Error
The server encountered an internal error or timed out; please retry.
503
Service Unavailable
The server is currently unable to receive requests; please retry.

3.8.9 Service Exceptions

List the service exceptions generated by the operation (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
MessageId
Text
Variables
Parent HTTP Code
SVC0001
A service error has occurred. Error code is <Error Explanation>
Error Explanation : <content here>
400
SVC0002
Invalid input value for Message part <part name>
part name : name of the input parameter that resulted in the error
400
SVC0002
Invalid input value for Message part offset. The offset must be greater than or equal to zero and less than the total number of objects
N/A
400
SVC0003
Invalid input value for Message part <part name>, valid values are <part values>
part value : value of input parameter that was found to be in error.
400

3.8.10 Policy Exceptions

List the policy exceptions generated by the operation (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
MessageId
Text
Variables
Parent HTTP Code
POL0001
A policy error occurred. For example, rate limit error, authentication and authorization error.
N/A
401,403
POL0001
Submitted limit is greater than the maximum allowed limit size or less than or equal to zero
N/A
403
POL1009
User has not been provisioned for %1
System that hasn’t been provisioned
403

3.9 Operation: Delete Album Media

3.9.1 Functional Behavior

Describe the functional behavior provided by this operation. Also add here any special considerations, assumptions, and dependencies for this particular operation
Remove media from an album belonging to a user.

3.9.2 Call flow

Insert below a sequence diagram (ping pong) diagram in context to a complete call flow or transaction with numbered arrows and some description explaining the sequence as appropriate.

3.9.3 Version Impact Summary

Summarize the different versions of this operation that are in production or deleted by the current release of this service.
Service Version
Major or Minor Impact
Changes Introduced by this Version
1
Major
Initial Release

3.9.4 Authentication and Authorization

Describe OAuth model applicable to this operation.
Authorization Model
Subscriber Authorization required?
OAuth Scope Value
Brief Description
OAuth
authorization_code
Yes
LOCKER
  1. Redirect user to AT&T authorization page to capture User consent
  2. Obtain Token obtained using authorization code issued by the gateway alonf the client key and secret by making an Oauth token call with GrantType=authorization_code

3.9.5 Representation Formats

In the table below, describe supported representation formats for the request and response body. Where different versions support different formats, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table.
Direction
Supported Respresentation Formats
Request
N/A
Response
XML, JSON

3.9.6 Input Parameters

In the table below, describe input parameters. Where different versions support different input parameters, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table. The allowed values for the Location in Request column are: Header, Resource URI, Body or Query Parameter.
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
accept
String
No
Specifies the format of the body of the response. Valid values are:
  • application/json
  • application/xml
The default value is application/json. Per rfc2616: "If no Accept header field is present, then it is assumed that the client accepts all media types." By default our services return application/json.
Normal Accept header processing rules shall be followed according to rfc2616.
Note: If there is no entity body in a normal successful response, this parameter can still be specified to determine the format in the case of an error response message.
Header
accept-encoding
String
No
Specifies the accept encoding format. When this header is present, the gateway should compress the response to indicate the client that response is in compressed format. Valid values are: gzip
Header
authorization
String
Yes
Specifies the authorization type and token. "Bearer" + OAuth Token – access_token. If the authorization header is missing, the system shall return an HTTP 400 Invalid Request message. If the token is invalid the system shall return an HTTP 401 Unauthorized message with a WWW-Authenticate HTTP header.
Header
albumId
Integer
Yes
Specifies the id of the album for which the media will be removed from.
URI Path
mediaIds
Integer
Yes
Specifies the ids of the media that need to be removed from the folder.
Query Parameter

3.9.6.1 Request – Example (Delete 2 media from an album)

This demonstrates how to delete 2 media from an album.
DELETE /locker/v1/albums/2234456/media?mediaIds=62588%2C55888 HTTP/1.1 


host: api.att.com


authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678


accept: application/xml

3.9.7 Output Parameters

In the table below, describe output parameters. Where different versions support different output parameters, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table. Note: ‘consent’ refers to end user consent which may need to be obtained before data is returned,
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
content-type
String
Yes
Specifies the type of content of the body of the entity. Must be set to one of the following values:
  • application/xml
  • application/json
Note: If there is no entity body in a normal successful response, this parameter is still needed to specify the format in the case of an error response message.
Header
content-encoding
String
No
Specifies the type of encoding used on the data. Supported values are: identity or gzip
Note: If there is no entity body in a normal successful response, this parameter is still needed to specify the format in the case of an error response message. Header
Header

3.9.7.1 Response – Example (Successful response to deleting media from an album)

This shows the response to deleting media from a album
HTTP/1.1 204 No Content


content-length: 0


date: Thu, 04 Jun 2010 02:51:59 GMT

3.9.8 HTTP Response Codes

List expected response codes (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
Code
Reason Phrase
Description
204
No Content
Successful response and the response does not include an entity.
400
Bad Request
Many possible reasons not specified by the other codes.
401
Authentication Error
Authentication failed or was not provided.
403
Forbidden
Access permission error.
404
Not Found
The server has not found anything matching the Request-URI. No indication is given of whether the condition is temporary or permanent.
414
Request-URI Too Long
The server is refusing to service the request because the Request-URI is longer than the server is willing to interpret.
500
Internal Server Error
The server encountered an internal error or timed out; please retry.
503
Service Unavailable
The server is currently unable to receive requests; please retry.

List the service exceptions generated by the operation (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
