3.10 Operation: Update Media

3.10.1 Functional Behavior

Describe the functional behavior provided by this operation. Also add here any special considerations, assumptions, and dependencies for this particular operation
Modifies a specific media object’s information. By default if a user attempts to update a media type with the name of a media type that already exists, system will throw an exception as it is not allowed.

3.10.2 Call flow

Insert below a sequence diagram (ping pong) diagram in context to a complete call flow or transaction with numbered arrows and some description explaining the sequence as appropriate.

3.10.3 Version Impact Summary

Summarize the different versions of this operation that are in production or deleted by the current release of this service.
Service Version
Major or Minor Impact
Changes Introduced by this Version
1
Major
Initial Release

3.10.4 Authentication and Authorization

Describe OAuth model applicable to this operation.
Authorization Model
Subscriber Authorization required?
OAuth Scope Value
Brief Description
OAuth
authorization_code
Yes
LOCKER
  1. Redirect user to AT&T authorization page to capture User consent
  2. Obtain Token obtained using authorization code issued by the gateway alonf the client key and secret by making an Oauth token call with GrantType=authorization_code

3.10.5 Representation Formats

In the table below, describe supported representation formats for the request and response body. Where different versions support different formats, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table.
Direction
Supported Respresentation Formats
Request
XML, JSON
Response
XML, JSON

3.10.6 Input Parameters

In the table below, describe input parameters. Where different versions support different input parameters, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table. The allowed values for the Location in Request column are: Header, Resource URI, Body or Query Parameter.
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
accept
String
No
Specifies the format of the body of the response. Valid values are:
  • application/json
  • application/xml
The default value is application/json. Per rfc2616: "If no Accept header field is present, then it is assumed that the client accepts all media types." By default our services return application/json.
Normal Accept header processing rules shall be followed according to rfc2616.
Note: If there is no entity body in a normal successful response, this parameter can still be specified to determine the format in the case of an error response message.
Header
accept-encoding
String
No
Specifies the accept encoding format. When this header is present, the gateway should compress the response to indicate the client that response is in compressed format. Valid values are: gzip
Header
authorization
String
Yes
Specifies the authorization type and token. "Bearer" + OAuth Token – access_token. If the authorization header is missing, the system shall return an HTTP 400 Invalid Request message. If the token is invalid the system shall return an HTTP 401 Unauthorized message with a WWW-Authenticate HTTP header.
Header
content-length
Integer
No
Specifies the length of the content in octets. This header parameter is only required for the non-streaming request.
Header
content-type
String
Yes
Specifies the type of content of the body of the entity. Must be set to one of the following values:
  • application/json
  • application/xml
Header
mediaId
Integer
Yes
Specifies the id of the media that needs to be updated
URI Path
media
Object
Yes
Contains the request information.
Body
name
String
No
Specifies the name of the media
Body
description
String
No
Specifies the description of the media
Body

3.10.6.1 Request – Example (Update media using XML)

This demonstrates how to update a media using XML.
PATCH /locker/v1/media/2234456 HTTP/1.1 


host: api.att.com


authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678


accept: application/xml


content-type: application/xml




<media>


      <description>I LIKE THIS NEW DESCRIPTION better.</description>


</media>

3.10.6.2 Request – Example (Update media using JSON)

This demonstrates how to update a media using JSON.
PATCH /locker/v1/media/2234456 HTTP/1.1 


host: api.att.com


content-type: application/json


authorization: Bearer 38C2399A23999


accept: application/json




{


  "media": { 


      "name": "my_new_file_name"


  }


}

Brief description

string
yes

  • audio/wav (or audio/x-wav)
  • audio/amr

string
No

object

Media Object

This table describes the parameters that belong to the media Object
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
id
String
Yes
Specifies the Id of the content object
body
name
String
Yes
Specifies the name of content object
body
creationDate
String
Yes
Specifies the date of media creation in the system.
body
description
String
Yes
Specifies the description of the entry
body
mimeType
String
Yes
Specifies the mime type of media i.e. “video/mp4; charset=binary”
body
url
AnyURI
Yes
Specifies the download URL
body
format
String
Yes
Specifies the computed media format.
body
extension
String
Yes
Specifies the media extension
body
shareCodes
Array
Yes
Specifies an array of share codes that this media object belongs to.
body
tags
Array
Yes
Specifies an array of tags that this media object is associated to.
body
accessBlocked
Boolean
Yes
Specifies whether or not the media can be accessed
body
sharingBlocked
Boolean
Yes
Specifies whether or not the media can be shared
body

AnyURI
Yes
Specifies the streaming URL.
Body

Array
Yes
Contains the metadata objects

Object
Yes

body

Yes

Contains the preview information.
Body

Object
Yes

body

Array
Yes
Contains the albums information.

Object
Yes

Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
status
String
No
Specifies the status, and the options are: pending, error, ok, infected, riskware, spyware, adware
body
detection
String
No
Specifies the detection name if infected, missing otherwise
body
message
String
No
Specifies the message for specifying state in case not clean, key missing otherwise.
body

3.10.7.1 Response – Example (Update Media response in XML)

This shows the response to a media update in XML format.
HTTP/1.1 200 OK


date: Wed, 27 Apr 2011 14:11:31 GMT


content-length:539


content-type: application/xml




<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>


<media>


    <accessBlocked>false</accessBlocked>


    <collections>


        <albums>


            <count>1</count>


            <creationDate>Wed, 04 May 2011 14:43:03 GMT</creationDate>


            <description>rename album descriptionl</description>


            <id>735</id>


            <name>rename album</name>


            <previews>


                <preview>


                    <format>jpg</format>


                    <height>240</height>


                    <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=113&amp;ticket=ae4c5a25-a1d7-4f14-a292-c9ad64aee4f0&amp;preview=320x240xjpg</url>


                    <width>320</width>


                </preview>


                <preview>


                    <format>jpg</format>


                    <height>90</height>


                    <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=113&amp;ticket=ae4c5a25-a1d7-4f14-a292-c9ad64aee4f0&amp;preview=120x90xjpg</url>


                    <width>120</width>


                </preview>


                <preview>


                    <format>jpg</format>


                    <height>480</height>


                    <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=113&amp;ticket=ae4c5a25-a1d7-4f14-a292-c9ad64aee4f0&amp;preview=640x480xjpg</url>


                    <width>640</width>


                </preview>


                <preview>


                    <format>3gp</format>


                    <height>98</height>


                    <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=113&amp;ticket=ae4c5a25-a1d7-4f14-a292-c9ad64aee4f0&amp;preview=176x98x3gp</url>


                    <width>176</width>


                </preview>


                <preview>


                    <format>3gp</format>


                    <height>180</height>


                    <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=113&amp;ticket=ae4c5a25-a1d7-4f14-a292-c9ad64aee4f0&amp;preview=320x180x3gp</url>


                    <width>320</width>


                </preview>


                <preview>


                    <format>mp4</format>


                    <height>98</height>


                    <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=113&amp;ticket=ae4c5a25-a1d7-4f14-a292-c9ad64aee4f0&amp;preview=176x98xmp4</url>


                    <width>176</width>


                </preview>


                <preview>


                    <format>mp4</format>


                    <height>180</height>


                    <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=113&amp;ticket=ae4c5a25-a1d7-4f14-a292-c9ad64aee4f0&amp;preview=320x180xmp4</url>


                    <width>320</width>


                </preview>


                <preview>


                    <format>flv</format>


                    <height>360</height>


                    <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=113&amp;ticket=ae4c5a25-a1d7-4f14-a292-c9ad64aee4f0&amp;preview=640x360xflv</url>


                    <width>640</width>


                </preview>


            </previews>


            <size>54085501</size>


        </albums>


    </collections>


    <av>


        <status>ok</status>


    </av>


<contentSize>54085501</contentSize>


    <creationDate>Mon, 02 May 2011 15:25:59 GMT</creationDate>


    <description>UPDATING DESCRIPTION</description>


    <extension>MOV</extension>


    <format>quicktime; charset=binary</format>


    <id>113</id>


    <metadataList>


        <metadata>


            <name>AudioBitrate</name>


            <value>1536</value>


        </metadata>


        <metadata>


            <name>Dimension</name>


            <value>1920x1080</value>


        </metadata>


        <metadata>


            <name>Drm</name>


            <value>0</value>


        </metadata>


        <metadata>


            <name>Duration</name>


            <value>9.3000000000000007</value>


        </metadata>


        <metadata>


            <name>VideoBitrate</name>


            <value>44980</value>


        </metadata>


        <metadata>


            <name>VideoCodec</name>


            <value>AVC</value>


        </metadata>


        <metadata>


            <name>VideoFps</name>


            <value>23.975999999999999</value>


        </metadata>


    </metadataList>


    <name>EatingAtTinDrum.MOV</name>


    <previews>


        <preview>


            <format>jpg</format>


            <height>240</height>


            <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=113&amp;ticket=ae4c5a25-a1d7-4f14-a292-c9ad64aee4f0&amp;preview=320x240xjpg</url>


            <width>320</width>


        </preview>


        <preview>


            <format>jpg</format>


            <height>90</height>


            <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=113&amp;ticket=ae4c5a25-a1d7-4f14-a292-c9ad64aee4f0&amp;preview=120x90xjpg</url>


            <width>120</width>


        </preview>


        <preview>


            <format>jpg</format>


            <height>480</height>


            <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=113&amp;ticket=ae4c5a25-a1d7-4f14-a292-c9ad64aee4f0&amp;preview=640x480xjpg</url>


            <width>640</width>


        </preview>


        <preview>


            <format>3gp</format>


            <height>98</height>


            <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=113&amp;ticket=ae4c5a25-a1d7-4f14-a292-c9ad64aee4f0&amp;preview=176x98x3gp</url>


            <width>176</width>


        </preview>


        <preview>


            <format>3gp</format>


            <height>180</height>


            <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=113&amp;ticket=ae4c5a25-a1d7-4f14-a292-c9ad64aee4f0&amp;preview=320x180x3gp</url>


            <width>320</width>


        </preview>


        <preview>


            <format>mp4</format>


            <height>98</height>


            <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=113&amp;ticket=ae4c5a25-a1d7-4f14-a292-c9ad64aee4f0&amp;preview=176x98xmp4</url>


            <width>176</width>


        </preview>


        <preview>


            <format>mp4</format>


            <height>180</height>


            <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=113&amp;ticket=ae4c5a25-a1d7-4f14-a292-c9ad64aee4f0&amp;preview=320x180xmp4</url>


            <width>320</width>


        </preview>


        <preview>


            <format>flv</format>


            <height>360</height>


            <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=113&amp;ticket=ae4c5a25-a1d7-4f14-a292-c9ad64aee4f0&amp;preview=640x360xflv</url>


            <width>640</width>


        </preview>


    </previews>


    <shareCodes>


        <shareCode>4d8d60bc-4c66-46fd-aedf-15d865b0c6d4</shareCode>


        <shareCode>5ca0b23d-372e-4af6-9775-9635a0818492</shareCode>


        <shareCode>afc37849-7541-4b0d-a6a2-2b5769786e07</shareCode>


        <shareCode>3423c5ee-b976-4959-b8b0-685b0581f2fe</shareCode>


        <shareCode>19eaaf8a-07f6-4f2f-80f5-a1e1175b8eb6</shareCode>


    </shareCodes>


    <sharingBlocked>false</sharingBlocked>


    <streamUrl>rtsp://streaming.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/ae4c5a25-a1d7-4f14-a292-c9ad64aee4f0/113_pc.3gp


    </streamUrl>


    <tags/>


    <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=113&amp;ticket=ae4c5a25-a1d7-4f14-a292-c9ad64aee4f0</url>


</media>

3.10.7.2 Response – Example (Update Media response in JSON)

This shows the response to a media update in JSON format.
HTTP/1.1 200 OK 


content-type: application/json 


content-length: 624 


date: Thu, 04 Jun 2010 02:51:59 GMT




{


  "media": {


    "accessBlocked": false,


    "collections": {


      "albums": {


        "count": 1,


        "creationDate": "Wed, 04 May 2011 14:43:03 GMT",


        "description": "rename album descriptionl",


        "id": 735,


        "name": "rename album",


        "previews": {


          "preview": [


            {


              "format": "jpg",


              "height": 240,


              "url": "https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=113&ticket=ae4c5a25-a1d7-4f14-a292-c9ad64aee4f0&preview=320x240xjpg",


              "width": 320


            },


            {


              "format": "jpg",


              "height": 90,


              "url": "https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=113&ticket=ae4c5a25-a1d7-4f14-a292-c9ad64aee4f0&preview=120x90xjpg",


              "width": 120


            },


            {


              "format": "jpg",


              "height": 480,


              "url": "https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=113&ticket=ae4c5a25-a1d7-4f14-a292-c9ad64aee4f0&preview=640x480xjpg",


              "width": 640


            },


            {


              "format": "3gp",


              "height": 98,


              "url": "https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=113&ticket=ae4c5a25-a1d7-4f14-a292-c9ad64aee4f0&preview=176x98x3gp",


              "width": 176


            },


            {


              "format": "3gp",


              "height": 180,


              "url": "https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/media/?content_id=113&ticket=ae4c5a25-a1d7-4f14-a292-c9ad64aee4f0&preview=320x180x3gp",


              "width": 320


            },


            {


              "format": "mp4",


              "height": 98,

              "width": 640


            }


          ]


        },


        "size": 54085501


      }


    },

  }


}

3.10.8 HTTP Response Codes

List expected response codes (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
Code
Reason Phrase
Description
200
OK
Successful response
400
Bad Request
Many possible reasons not specified by the other codes.
401
Authentication Error
Authentication failed or was not provided.
403
Forbidden
Access permission error.
404
Not Found
The server has not found anything matching the Request-URI. No indication is given of whether the condition is temporary or permanent.
411
Length Required
The Content-Length header was not specified.
413
Request Entity Too Large
The size of the request body exceed the maximum size permitted.
415
Unsupported Media Type
The request is in a format not supported by the requested resource for the requested method.
500
Internal Server Error
The server encountered an internal error or timed out; please retry.
503
Service Unavailable
The server is currently unable to receive requests; please retry.

3.10.9 Service Exceptions

List the service exceptions generated by the operation (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
MessageId
Text
Variables
Parent HTTP Code
SVC0001
A service error has occurred. Error code is <Error Explanation>
Error Explanation : <content here>
400
SVC0002
Invalid input value for Message part <part name>
part name : name of the input parameter that resulted in the error
400

3.10.10 Policy Exceptions

List the policy exceptions generated by the operation (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
MessageId
Text
Variables
Parent HTTP Code
POL0001
A policy error occurred. For example, rate limit error, authentication and authorization error.
N/A
401,403
POL1009
User has not been provisioned for %1
System that hasn’t been provisioned
403

3.11 Operation: Create Playlist

3.11.1 Functional Behavior Create playlist

This method is used to create a new playlist . If a user attempts to create an playlist to a name that is already in use, the api will throw an exception as it is not allowed
Create a new playlist for a user.

3.11.2 Call flow

Insert below a sequence diagram (ping pong) diagram in context to a complete call flow or transaction with numbered arrows and some description explaining the sequence as appropriate.

3.11.3 Version Impact Summary

Summarize the different versions of this operation that are in production or deleted by the current release of this service.
Service Version
Major or Minor Impact
Changes Introduced by this Version
1
Major
Initial Release

3.11.4 Authentication and Authorization

Describe OAuth model applicable to this operation.
Authorization Model
Subscriber Authorization required?
OAuth Scope Value
Brief Description
OAuth
authorization_code
Yes
LOCKER
  1. Redirect user to AT&T authorization page to capture User consent
  2. Obtain Token obtained using authorization code issued by the gateway alonf the client key and secret by making an Oauth token call with GrantType=authorization_code

3.11.5 Representation Formats

In the table below, describe supported representation formats for the request and response body. Where different versions support different formats, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table.
Direction
Supported Respresentation Formats
Request
XML, JSON
Response
XML, JSON

3.11.6 Input Parameters

In the table below, describe input parameters. Where different versions support different input parameters, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table. The allowed values for the Location in Request column are: Header, Resource URI, Body or Query Parameter.
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
accept
String
No
Specifies the format of the body of the response. Valid values are:
  • application/json
  • application/xml
The default value is application/json. Per rfc2616: "If no Accept header field is present, then it is assumed that the client accepts all media types." By default our services return application/json.
Normal Accept header processing rules shall be followed according to rfc2616.
Note: If there is no entity body in a normal successful response, this parameter can still be specified to determine the format in the case of an error response message..
Header
accept-encoding
String
No
Specifies the accept encoding format. When this header is present, the gateway should compress the response to indicate the client that response is in compressed format. Valid values are: gzip
Header
authorization
String
Yes
Specifies the authorization type and token. "Bearer" + OAuth Token – access_token. If the authorization header is missing, the system shall return an HTTP 400 Invalid Request message. If the token is invalid the system shall return an HTTP 401 Unauthorized message with a WWW-Authenticate HTTP header.
Header
content-length
Integer
Yes
Specifies the length of the content in octets.
Header
content-type
String
Yes
Specifies the type of content of the body of the entity. Must be set to one of the following values:
  • application/json
  • application/xml
Header
playlist
Object
Yes
Contains the request information for creating a playlist
Body
name
String
Yes
Specifies the name of playlist
Body
description
String
No
Specifies the description of the playlist
Body

3.11.6.1 Request – Example (XML)

This demonstrates how to create a playlist. The response format will be in XML.
POST /locker/v1/playlists HTTP/1.1 


host: api.att.com


authorization: bearer abcdef12345678


accept: application/xml


content-type: application/xml




<playlist>


      <name>Favorite Music</name>


      <description>Old School</description>


</playlist>

3.11.6.2 Request – Example (JSON)

This demonstrates how to create an playlist. The response format will be in JSON.
POST /locker/v1/playlists HTTP/1.1 


host: api.att.com 


authorization: bearer abcdef12345678


accept: application/json


content-type: application/json




{


  "playlist": {


    "name": "Favorite Music",


    "description": "Old School"


  }


}

3.11.7 Output Parameters

In the table below, describe output parameters. Where different versions support different output parameters, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table. Note: ‘consent’ refers to end user consent which may need to be obtained before data is returned,
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
content-type
String
yes
Specifies the type of content of the body of the entity. Must be set to one of the following values:
  • applciation/json
  • application/xml
Body
content-encoding
String
No
Specifies the type of encoding used on the data. Supported values are: identity or gzip
Header
location
AnyURI
Yes
Specifies the location of the newly created resource. This URI can be used to interact with the newly created resource. See Get Playlist Contents for how the URI is structured.
Header
playlist
Object
Yes
Contains the response information for creating a playlist
Body

Playlist Object

This table describes the parameters that belong to the playlist Object
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
id
String
Yes
Specifies the Id of the content object
Body
name
String
No
Specifies the name of content object
Body
creationDate
String
No
Specifies the date of playlist creation in the system.
Body
size
Integer
No
Specifies the size of the playlist in bytes
Body
description
String
No
Specifies the description of the entry
Body
shareCodes
Array
No
Specifies an array of Sshare codes that this media object belongs to.
Body

3.11.7.1 Response – Example ( XML)

This shows the response to an playlist creation in XML format.
HTTP/1.1 201 Created


date: Wed, 27 Apr 2013 14:11:31 GMT


content-length: 223


content-type: application/xml


location: https://api.att.com/locker/v1/playlists/735




<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>


<playlist>


    <count>0</count>


    <creationDate>Wed, 04 May 2013 14:43:03 GMT</creationDate>


    <description>Old School</description>


    <id>735</id>


    <name>Favorite Music</name>


    <size>0</size>


</playlist>

3.11.7.2 Response – Example (JSON)

This shows the response to an playlist creation in JSON format
HTTP/1.1 201 Created


date: Wed, 27 Apr 2013 14:11:31 GMT


content-length: 223


content-type: application/json


location: https://api.att.com/locker/v1/playlists/735




{


  "playlist": {


    "count": 0,


    "creationDate": "Wed, 04 May 2013 14:43:03 GMT",


    "description": "Old School",


    "id": 735,


    "name": "Favorite Music",


    "size": 0


  }


}

3.11.8 HTTP Response Codes

List expected response codes (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
Code
Reason Phrase
Description
201
Created
Successful response and resource was successfully created.
400
Bad Request
Many possible reasons not specified by the other codes.
401
Authentication Error
Authentication failed or was not provided.
403
Forbidden
Access permission error.
404
Not Found
The server has not found anything matching the Request-URI. No indication is given of whether the condition is temporary or permanent.
405
Method Not Allowed
A request was made of a resource using a request method not supported by that resource (e.g., using PUT on a REST resource that only supports POST).
408
Request Timeout
The client did not produce a request within the time that the server was prepared to wait. The client MAY repeat the request without modifications at any later time.
411
Length Required
The Content-Length header was not specified.
413
Request Entity Too Large
The size of the request body exceed the maximum size permitted.
415
Unsupported Media Type
The request is in a format not supported by the requested resource for the requested method.
500
Internal Server Error
The server encountered an internal error or timed out; please retry.
503
Service Unavailable
The server is currently unable to receive requests; please retry.

3.11.9 Service Exceptions

List the service exceptions generated by the operation (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
MessageId
Text
Variables
Parent HTTP Code
SVC0001
A service error has occurred. Error is <Error Explanation>
Error Explanation : <content here>
400
SVC0002
Invalid input value for Message part 'name'. Playlist name already exists
Error Explanation : <content here>
400
SVC0002
Invalid input value for Message part <part name>
part name : name of the input parameter that resulted in the error
400
SVC0003
Invalid input value for Message part <part name>, valid values are <part values>
part value : value of input parameter that was found to be in error.
400

3.11.10 Policy Exceptions

List the policy exceptions generated by the operation (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):

Text
Variables

A policy error occurred. For example, rate limit error, authentication and authorization error.
N/A
401,403
POL0001

N/A

3.12 Operation: Get Playlist Listing

3.12.1 Functional Behavior

Describe the functional behavior provided by this operation. Also add here any special considerations, assumptions, and dependencies for this particular operation
Get the list of playlists for a user.

3.12.2 Call flow

Insert below a sequence diagram (ping pong) diagram in context to a complete call flow or transaction with numbered arrows and some description explaining the sequence as appropriate.

3.12.3 Version Impact Summary

Summarize the different versions of this operation that are in production or deleted by the current release of this service.
Service Version
Major or Minor Impact
Changes Introduced by this Version
1
Major
Initial Release

3.12.4 Authentication and Authorization

Describe OAuth model applicable to this operation.
Authorization Model
Subscriber Authorization required?
OAuth Scope Value
Brief Description
OAuth
authorization_code
Yes
LOCKER
  1. Redirect user to AT&T authorization page to capture User consent
  2. Obtain Token obtained using authorization code issued by the gateway alonf the client key and secret by making an Oauth token call with GrantType=authorization_code

3.12.5 Representation Formats

In the table below, describe supported representation formats for the request and response body. Where different versions support different formats, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table.
Direction
Supported Respresentation Formats
Request
N/A
Response
XML, JSON

3.12.6 Input Parameters

In the table below, describe input parameters. Where different versions support different input parameters, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table. The allowed values for the Location in Request column are: Header, Resource URI, Body or Query Parameter.
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
accept
String
No
Specifies the format of the body of the response. Valid values are:
  • application/json
  • application/xml
The default value is application/json. Per rfc2616: "If no Accept header field is present, then it is assumed that the client accepts all media types." By default our services return application/json.
Normal Accept header processing rules shall be followed according to rfc2616.
Note: If there is no entity body in a normal successful response, this parameter can still be specified to determine the format in the case of an error response message.
Header
accept-encoding
String
No
Specifies the accept encoding format. When this header is present, the gateway should compress the response to indicate the client that response is in compressed format. Valid values are: gzip
Header
authorization
String
Yes
Specifies the authorization type and token. "Bearer" + OAuth Token – access_token. If the authorization header is missing, the system shall return an HTTP 400 Invalid Request message. If the token is invalid the system shall return an HTTP 401 Unauthorized message with a WWW-Authenticate HTTP header.
Header
limit
Integer
Yes
Specifies the max number of results returned.
Made it required, so no more default
Query Parameter
offset
Changed to “offset” from “marker” to align with IAM
Integer
Yes
Specifies the scroll set pointer on the results collection.
Query Parameter
orderBy
String
No
Specifies the sorting criteria. The valid values for sort are: name, creationDate, size, count
Can there be multiple?
Default: name
Query Parameter
order
String
No
The sorting order. The valid values are: asc, desc
Default: asc
how was this spec'ed in other APIs???
Query Parameter

3.12.6.1 Request – Example (Get playlists based on query parameters)

This demonstrates how to get playlists using GET, and specifying the response to be in XML.
GET /locker/v1/playlists?limit=100&offset=15&orderBy=name&order=asc HTTP/1.1 


host: api.att.com


authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678


accept: application/xml

3.12.7 Output Parameters

In the table below, describe output parameters. Where different versions support different output parameters, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table. Note: ‘consent’ refers to end user consent which may need to be obtained before data is returned,
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
content-type
String
Yes
Specifies the type of content of the body of the entity. Must be set to one of the following values:
  • audio/wav (or audio/x-wav)
  • audio/amr
Header
content-encoding
String
No
Specifies the type of encoding used on the data. Supported values are: identity or gzip
Header
playlists
Object
Yes
Specifies the object which contains the list of playlists
Body
total
Integer
Yes
Specifies the total number of playlists in a user’s account
Body
count
should this be renamed?
Integer
Yes
Specifies the number of playlists returned in this response
Body
playlist
Object
Yes
Specifies the object which contain playlist information
Body

Playlist Object

This table describes the parameters that belong to the playlist Object
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
id
String
Yes
Specifies the Id of the content object
Body
name
String
Yes
Specifies the name of content object
Body

String
Yes
Specifies the date of playlist creation in the system.
Body

Integer
Yes
Specifies the size of the playlist in bytes
Body
description
String
Yes
Specifies the description of the entry
Body

3.12.7.1 Response – Example (Get All playlists in XML)

This shows the response to a Get All playlists in XML format.
HTTP/1.1 200 OK


date: wed, 27 apr 2011 14:11:31 gmt


content-length: 223


content-type: application/xml




<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>


<playlists>


    <count>2</count>


    <playlist>


        <count>0</count>


        <creationDate>01-01-2012 11:01:58 +0000</creationDate>


        <description>ONLY A TEST</description>


        <id>683</id>


        <name>Album</name>


        <size>0</size>


    </playlist>


    <playlist>


        <count>0</count>


        <creationDate>01-01-2012 11:01:58 +0000</creationDate>


        <description>ONLY A TEST</description>


        <id>747</id>


        <name>Album</name>


        <size>0</size>


    </playlist>


    <total>2</total>


</playlists>

3.12.7.2 Response – Example (Get All playlists in JSON)

This shows the response to a Get All playlists in JSON format.
HTTP/1.1 200 OK 


content-type: application/json 


content-length: 624 


date: Thu, 04 Jun 2010 02:51:59 GMT




{


  "playlists": {


    "count": 2,


    "playlist": [


      {


        "count": 0,


        "creationDate": "01-01-2012 11:01:58 +0000",


        "description": "ONLY A TEST",


        "id": 683,


        "name": "Album",


        "size": 0


      },


      {


        "count": 0,


        "creationDate": "01-01-2012 11:01:58 +0000",


        "description": "ONLY A TEST",


        "id": 747,


        "name": "Album",


        "size": 0


      }


    ],


    "total": 2


  }


}

3.12.8 HTTP Response Codes

List expected response codes (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
Code
Reason Phrase
Description
200
OK
Successful response
400
Bad Request
Many possible reasons not specified by the other codes.
401
Authentication Error
Authentication failed or was not provided.
403
Forbidden
Access permission error.
404
Not Found
The server has not found anything matching the Request-URI. No indication is given of whether the condition is temporary or permanent.
405
Method Not Allowed
A request was made of a resource using a request method not supported by that resource (e.g., using PUT on a REST resource that only supports POST).
408
Request Timeout
The client did not produce a request within the time that the server was prepared to wait. The client MAY repeat the request without modifications at any later time.
411
Length Required
The Content-Length header was not specified.
414
Request-URI Too Long
The server is refusing to service the request because the Request-URI is longer than the server is willing to interpret.
415
Unsupported Media Type
The request is in a format not supported by the requested resource for the requested method.
500
Internal Server Error
The server encountered an internal error or timed out; please retry.
503
Service Unavailable
The server is currently unable to receive requests; please retry.

3.12.9 Service Exceptions

List the service exceptions generated by the operation (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
MessageId
Text
Variables
Parent HTTP Code
SVC0001
A service error has occurred. Error code is <Error Explanation>
Error Explanation : <content here>
400
SVC0002
Invalid input value for Message part <part name>
part name : name of the input parameter that resulted in the error
400
SVC0002
Invalid input value for Message part offset. The offset must be greater than or equal to zero and less than the total number of objects
N/A
400
SVC0003
Invalid input value for Message part <part name>, valid values are <part values>
part value : value of input parameter that was found to be in error.
400

3.12.10 Policy Exceptions

List the policy exceptions generated by the operation (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
MessageId
Text
Variables
Parent HTTP Code
POL0001
A policy error occurred. For example, rate limit error, authentication and authorization error.
N/A
401,403
POL0001
Submitted limit is greater than the maximum allowed limit size or less than or equal to zero
N/A
403
POL1009
User has not been provisioned for %1
System that hasn’t been provisioned
403

3.13 Operation: Delete Playlist

3.13.1 Functional Behavior

Describe the functional behavior provided by this operation. Also add here any special considerations, assumptions, and dependencies for this particular operation
Delete a playlist for a user.

3.13.2 Call flow

Insert below a sequence diagram (ping pong) diagram in context to a complete call flow or transaction with numbered arrows and some description explaining the sequence as appropriate.

3.13.3 Version Impact Summary

Summarize the different versions of this operation that are in production or deleted by the current release of this service.
Service Version
Major or Minor Impact
Changes Introduced by this Version
1
Major
Initial Release

3.13.4 Authentication and Authorization

Describe OAuth model applicable to this operation.
Authorization Model
Subscriber Authorization required?
OAuth Scope Value
Brief Description
OAuth
authorization_code
Yes
LOCKER
  1. Redirect user to AT&T authorization page to capture User consent
  2. Obtain Token obtained using authorization code issued by the gateway alonf the client key and secret by making an Oauth token call with GrantType=authorization_code

3.13.5 Representation Formats

In the table below, describe supported representation formats for the request and response body. Where different versions support different formats, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table.
Direction
Supported Respresentation Formats
Request
N/A
Response
XML, JSON

3.13.6 Input Parameters

In the table below, describe input parameters. Where different versions support different input parameters, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table. The allowed values for the Location in Request column are: Header, Resource URI, Body or Query Parameter.
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
accept
String
No
Specifies the format of the body of the response. Valid values are:
  • application/json
  • application/xml
The default value is application/json. Per rfc2616: "If no Accept header field is present, then it is assumed that the client accepts all media types." By default our services return application/json.
Normal Accept header processing rules shall be followed according to rfc2616.
Note: If there is no entity body in a normal successful response, this parameter can still be specified to determine the format in the case of an error response message.
Header
accept-encoding
String
No
Specifies the accept encoding format. When this header is present, the gateway should compress the response to indicate the client that response is in compressed format. Valid values are: gzip
Header
authorization
String
Yes
Specifies the authorization type and token. "Bearer" + OAuth Token – access_token. If the authorization header is missing, the system shall return an HTTP 400 Invalid Request message. If the token is invalid the system shall return an HTTP 401 Unauthorized message with a WWW-Authenticate HTTP header.
Header
playlistId
Integer
Yes
Specifies the id of the playlist that needs to be deleted
URI Path

3.13.6.1 Request – Example (delete a playlist)

This demonstrates how to delete a playlist, and specifying the response to be in XML.
DELETE /locker/v1/playlists/4322132 HTTP/1.1 


host: api.att.com


authorization: Bearer 38C2399A23999


accept: application/xml

3.13.7 Output Parameters

In the table below, describe output parameters. Where different versions support different output parameters, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table. Note: ‘consent’ refers to end user consent which may need to be obtained before data is returned,
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
content-type
string
yes
Specifies the type of content of the body of the entity. Must be set to one of the following values:
  • application/xml
  • application/json
Note: If there is no entity body in a normal successful response, this parameter is still needed to specify the format in the case of an error response message.
Header
content-encoding
String
No
Specifies the type of encoding used on the data. Supported values are: identity or gzip
Note: If there is no entity body in a normal successful response, this parameter is still needed to specify the format in the case of an error response message.
Header

3.13.7.1 Response – Example (Response to deleting a playlist)

This shows a successful response to Delete playlist request.
HTTP/1.1 204 No Content


content-length: 0


date: Thu, 04 Jun 2010 02:51:59 GMT

3.13.8 HTTP Response Codes

List expected response codes (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
Code
Reason Phrase
Description
204
No Content
Successful response and the response does not include an entity.
400
Bad Request
Many possible reasons not specified by the other codes.
401
Authentication Error
Authentication failed or was not provided.
403
Forbidden
Access permission error.
404
Not Found
The server has not found anything matching the Request-URI. No indication is given of whether the condition is temporary or permanent.
408
Request Timeout
The client did not produce a request within the time that the server was prepared to wait. The client MAY repeat the request without modifications at any later time.
500
Internal Server Error
The server encountered an internal error or timed out; please retry.
503
Service Unavailable
The server is currently unable to receive requests; please retry.

3.14 Operation: Update Playlist

Describe the functional behavior provided by this operation. Also add here any special considerations, assumptions, and dependencies for this particular operation
Modifies the information of a specific playlist belonging to the specified user.

3.14.2 Call flow

Insert below a sequence diagram (ping pong) diagram in context to a complete call flow or transaction with numbered arrows and some description explaining the sequence as appropriate.

Summarize the different versions of this operation that are in production or deleted by the current release of this service.

3.14.4 Authentication and Authorization

Describe OAuth model applicable to this operation.
Authorization Model
Subscriber Authorization required?
OAuth Scope Value
Brief Description
OAuth
authorization_code
Yes
LOCKER
  1. Redirect user to AT&T authorization page to capture User consent
  2. Obtain Token obtained using authorization code issued by the gateway alonf the client key and secret by making an Oauth token call with GrantType=authorization_code

3.14.6 Input Parameters

In the table below, describe input parameters. Where different versions support different input parameters, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table. The allowed values for the Location in Request column are: Header, Resource URI, Body or Query Parameter.
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
accept
String
No
Specifies the format of the body of the response. Valid values are:
  • application/json
  • application/xml
The default value is application/json. Per rfc2616: "If no Accept header field is present, then it is assumed that the client accepts all media types." By default our services return application/json.
Normal Accept header processing rules shall be followed according to rfc2616.
Note: If there is no entity body in a normal successful response, this parameter can still be specified to determine the format in the case of an error response message.
Header
accept-encoding
String
No
Specifies the accept encoding format. When this header is present, the gateway should compress the response to indicate the client that response is in compressed format. Valid values are: gzip
Header
authorization
String
Yes
Specifies the authorization type and token. "Bearer" + OAuth Token – access_token. If the authorization header is missing, the system shall return an HTTP 400 Invalid Request message. If the token is invalid the system shall return an HTTP 401 Unauthorized message with a WWW-Authenticate HTTP header.
Header
content-length
Integer
No
Specifies the length of the content in octets. This header parameter is only required for the non-streaming request.
Header
content-type
String
Yes
Specifies the type of content of the body of the entity. Must be set to one of the following values:
  • application/json
  • application/xml
Header
playlistId
Integer
Yes
Specifies id of the playlist that is being updated
URI Path
playlist
Object
Yes
Specifies the object that contains the playlist information
Body
name
String
No
Specifies the name of the playlist. Length (1 - 255) inclusive. Must not contain “/” or “\” characters.
Body
description
String
No
Specifies the description of the playlist. Length (0 - 1024) inclusive. Must not contain “/” or “\” characters.
Body
reorder
Object
No
Contains the reorder information
Body

Reorder Object

This table specifies the parameters that belong to the reorder object.
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
indexes
rename???
are these Integers or Strings??
Array
Yes
Specifies the indexes of the files that need to move.
body
after
rename???
are these Integers or Strings??
Integer
Yes
Specifies the index where the files should be moved after.
body

3.14.6.1 Request – Example (Update a playlist - XML)

This demonstrates how to update a playlist, and specifying the response to be in XML.
Need to determine if PATCH is correct here, and whether frameworks support it
PATCH /locker/v1/playlists/3223232 HTTP/1.1 


host: api.att.com856


content-type: application/xml


authorization: Bearer 38C2399A23999


accept: application/xml




<playlist>


    <description>I LIKE THIS NEW DESCRIPTION better.</description>


    <reorder>


        <indexes>1</indexes>


        <after>2</after>


    </reorder>


</playlist>

3.14.6.2 Request – Example (Update a playlist - JSON)

This demonstrates how to update a playlist, the response format will be in JSON.
PATCH /locker/v1/playlists/3223232 HTTP/1.1 


host: api.att.com


content-type: application/json


authorization: Bearer 38C2399A23999


accept: application/json




{


  "playlist": { 


      "description": "I LIKE THIS NEW DESCRIPTION better.",


      "reorder": {


          "indexes": 1,


          "after": 2


      }


  }


}

3.14.7.1 Response – Example (Update playlist - XML)

This shows the response to an Update playlist in XML format.
HTTP/1.1 200 OK


date: Wed, 27 Apr 2011 14:11:31 GMT


content-length: 223


content-type: application/xml




<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>


<playlist>


    <count>0</count>


    <creationDate>05-05-2011 14:17:27 +0000</creationDate>


    <description>I LIKE THIS NEW DESCRIPTION better.</description>


    <id>3223232</id>


    <name>Bunch of random Files playlist</name>


    <size>0</size>


</playlist>

3.14.7.2 Response – Example (Update playlist - JSON)

This shows the response to an Update playlist in JSON format
HTTP/1.1 200 OK


date: Wed, 27 Apr 2011 14:11:31 GMT


content-length: 223


content-type: application/json




{


    "playlist": {


      "count": 0,


      "creationDate": "05-05-2011 14:17:27 +0000",


      "name": "Bunch of random Files playlist",


      "description": "Cuz i need space",


      "id": 3223232,


      "size": 0


    }


}

3.14.8 HTTP Response Codes

List expected response codes (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
Code
Reason Phrase
Description
200
OK
Successful response
400
Bad Request
Many possible reasons not specified by the other codes.
401
Authentication Error
Authentication failed or was not provided.
403
Forbidden
Access permission error.
404
Not Found
The server has not found anything matching the Request-URI. No indication is given of whether the condition is temporary or permanent.
408
Request Timeout
The client did not produce a request within the time that the server was prepared to wait. The client MAY repeat the request without modifications at any later time.
411
Length Required
The Content-Length header was not specified.
413
Request Entity Too Large
The size of the request body exceed the maximum size permitted.
414
Request-URI Too Long
The server is refusing to service the request because the Request-URI is longer than the server is willing to interpret.
415
Unsupported Media Type
The request is in a format not supported by the requested resource for the requested method.
500
Internal Server Error
The server encountered an internal error or timed out; please retry.
503
Service Unavailable
The server is currently unable to receive requests; please retry.

accept

  • application/json
  • application/xml

Query Parameter
offset
Integer
Yes
Specifies the scroll set pointer on the results collection.
Query Parameter
orderBy
String
No
Specifies the sorting criteria. Constraints: name, creationdate, size, count
Default: name
Query Parameter
order
String
No
Specifies the sorting order. Constraints: asc, desc
Default: asc
how was this spec'ed in other APIs???
Query Parameter

3.15.6.1 Request – Example (Get playlist listing)

This demonstrates how to get playlist contents using GET with query parameters, and specifying the response to be in JSON.
GET /locker/v1/playlists/22323232?limit=20&offset=10&order=asc HTTP/1.1 


host: api.att.com


authorization: Bearer 38C2399A23999


accept: application/json


accept-encoding: gzip

body
detection
String
No
Specifies the detection name if infected, missing otherwise
body
message
String
No
Specifies the message for specifying state in case not clean, key missing otherwise.
body

Preview Object

This table describes the parameters that belong to the preview object
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
format
String
Yes
Specifies the format of preview
body
url
AnyURI
Yes
Specifies the download url
body
width
Integer
Yes
Specifies the width of preview (image/video)
body
height
Integer
Yes
Specifies the height of preview (image/video)
body
bitrate
Integer
Yes
Specifies the preview bitrate (audio)
body
channels
Integer
Yes
Specifies the audio channels (audio)
body

3.15.7.1 Response – Example (playlist Content Listing in XML)

This shows the response to a Playlist listing request in XML format.
HTTP/1.1 200 OK


content-type: application/xml 


content-length: 539


date: Thu, 04 Jun 2010 02:51:59 GMT




<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>


<content>


    <count>1</count>


    <total>1</total>


    <tracks>


        <track>


            <accessBlocked>false</accessBlocked>


            <av>


                <status>ok</status>


            </av>


            <contentSize>4102272</contentSize>


            <creationDate>05-02-2011 14:06:49 +0000</creationDate>


            <description></description>


            <extension>mp3</extension>


            <format>mpeg</format>


            <id>109</id>


            <metadataList>


                <metadata>


                    <name>Album</name>


                    <value>Final Fantasy VIII Piano Collection</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>Artist</name>


                    <value>FF8</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>AudioBitrate</name>


                    <value>160</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>AudioCodec</name>


                    <value>MPEG Audio</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>Author</name>


                    <value>FF8</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>Drm</name>


                    <value>0</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>Duration</name>


                    <value>206.316</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>Genre</name>


                    <value>Game</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>Title</name>


                    <value>Eyes on Me</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>TrackNumber</name>


                    <value>02</value>


                </metadata>


            </metadataList>


            <name>I love M&amp;M's.mp3</name>


            <collections>


                <playlists>


                    <count>1</count>


                    <creationDate>05-04-2011 18:48:47 +0000</creationDate>


                    <description>Old School</description>


                    <id>797</id>


                    <name>Album</name>


                    <size>4102272</size>


                </playlists>


            </collections>


            <previews>


                <preview>


                    <format>jpg</format>


                    <height>240</height>


                    <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/track/?content_id=109&amp;ticket=ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1&amp;preview=320x240xjpg</url>


                    <width>320</width>


                </preview>


                <preview>


                    <format>jpg</format>


                    <height>90</height>


                    <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/track/?content_id=109&amp;ticket=ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1&amp;preview=120x90xjpg</url>


                    <width>120</width>


                </preview>


                <preview>


                    <format>jpg</format>


                    <height>480</height>


                    <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/track/?content_id=109&amp;ticket=ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1&amp;preview=640x480xjpg</url>


                    <width>640</width>


                </preview>


                <preview>


                    <bitrate>1536k</bitrate>


                    <channels>2</channels>


                    <format>wav</format>


                    <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/track/?content_id=109&amp;ticket=ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1&amp;preview=1536kx2xwav</url>


                </preview>


                <preview>


                    <bitrate>302k</bitrate>


                    <channels>1</channels>


                    <format>aac</format>


                    <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/track/?content_id=109&amp;ticket=ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1&amp;preview=32kx1xaac</url>


                </preview>


                <preview>


                    <bitrate>64k</bitrate>


                    <channels>2</channels>


                    <format>aac</format>


                    <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/track/?content_id=109&amp;ticket=ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1&amp;preview=64kx2xaac</url>


                </preview>


            </previews>


            <shareCodes/>


            <sharingBlocked>false</sharingBlocked>


            <streamUrl>


                rtsp://streaming.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1/109_pc.3gp


            </streamUrl>


            <tags/>


            <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/track/?content_id=109&amp;ticket=ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1</url>


        </track>


    </tracks>


</content>

3.15.7.2 Response – Example (playlist Content Listing in JSON)

This shows the response to a playlist listing request in JSON format
HTTP/1.1 200 OK 


content-type: application/json 


content-length: 624 


date: Thu, 04 Jun 2010 02:51:59 GMT




{


  "content": {


    "count": 1,


    "total": 1,


    "tracks": {


      "track": {


        "accessBlocked": false,


        "av": { "status": "ok" },


        "contentSize": 4102272,


        "creationDate": "05-02-2011 14:06:49 +0000",


        "extension": "mp3",


        "format": "mpeg",


        "id": 109,


        "metadataList": {


          "metadata": [


            {


              "name": "Album",


              "value": "Final Fantasy VIII Piano Collection"


            },


            {


              "name": "Artist",


              "value": "FF8"


            },


            {


              "name": "AudioBitrate",


              "value": "160"


            },


            {


              "name": "AudioCodec",


              "value": "MPEG Audio"


            },


            {


              "name": "Author",


              "value": "FF8"


            },


            {


              "name": "Drm",


              "value": "0"


            },


            {


              "name": "Duration",


              "value": "206.316"


            },


            {


              "name": "Genre",


              "value": "Game"


            },


            {


              "name": "Title",


              "value": "Eyes on Me"


            },


            {


              "name": "TrackNumber",


              "value": "02"


            }


          ]


        },


        "name": "I love M&M's.mp3",


        "collections": {


          "playlists": {


            "count": 1,


            "creationDate": "05-04-2011 18:48:47 +0000",


            "description": "Old School",


            "id": 797,


            "name": "Album",


            "size": 4102272


          }


        },


        "previews": {


          "preview": [


            {


              "format": "jpg",


              "height": 240,


              "url": "https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/track/?content_id=109&ticket=ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1&preview=320x240xjpg",


              "width": "320"


            },


            {


              "format": "jpg",


              "height": 90,


              "url": "https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/track/?content_id=109&ticket=ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1&preview=120x90xjpg",


              "width": 120


            },


            {


              "format": "jpg",


              "height": 480,


              "url": "https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/track/?content_id=109&ticket=ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1&preview=640x480xjpg",


              "width": "640"


            },


            {


              "bitrate": "1536k",


              "channels": "2",


              "format": "wav",


              "url": "https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/track/?content_id=109&ticket=ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1&preview=1536kx2xwav"


            },


            {


              "bitrate": "32k",


              "channels": "1",


              "format": "aac",


              "url": "https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/track/?content_id=109&ticket=ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1&preview=32kx1xaac"


            },


            {


              "bitrate": "64k",


              "channels": 2,


              "format": "aac",


              "url": "https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/track/?content_id=109&ticket=ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1&preview=64kx2xaac"


            }


          ]


        },


        "sharingBlocked": false,


        "streamUrl": "


                rtsp://streaming.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1/109_pc.3gp


            ",


        "url": "https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/track/?content_id=109&ticket=ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1"


      }


    }


  }


}

3.15.8 HTTP Response Codes

List expected response codes (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
Code
Reason Phrase
Description
200
OK
Successful response
400
Bad Request
Many possible reasons not specified by the other codes.
401
Authentication Error
Authentication failed or was not provided.
403
Forbidden
Access permission error.
404
Not Found
The server has not found anything matching the Request-URI. No indication is given of whether the condition is temporary or permanent.
414
Request-URI Too Long
The server is refusing to service the request because the Request-URI is longer than the server is willing to interpret.
500
Internal Server Error
The server encountered an internal error or timed out; please retry.
503
Service Unavailable
The server is currently unable to receive requests; please retry.

3.15.9 Service Exceptions

List the service exceptions generated by the operation (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
MessageId
Text
Variables
Parent HTTP Code
SVC0001
A service error has occurred. Error code is <Error Explanation>
Error Explanation : <content here>
400
SVC0002
Invalid input value for Message part <part name>
part name : name of the input parameter that resulted in the error
400
SVC0002
Invalid input value for Message part offset. The offset must be greater than or equal to zero and less than the total number of objects
N/A
400
SVC0003
Invalid input value for Message part <part name>, valid values are <part values>
part value : value of input parameter that was found to be in error.
400

3.15.10 Policy Exceptions

List the policy exceptions generated by the operation (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
MessageId
Text
Variables
Parent HTTP Code
POL0001
A policy error occurred. For example, rate limit error, authentication and authorization error.
N/A
401,403
POL0001
Submitted limit is greater than the maximum allowed limit size or less than or equal to zero
N/A
403
POL1009
User has not been provisioned for %1
System that hasn’t been provisioned
403

3.16 Operation: Add Tracks to Playlist

3.16.1 Functional Behavior

Describe the functional behavior provided by this operation. Also add here any special considerations, assumptions, and dependencies for this particular operation
Insert a track into a playlist belonging to a user. Adding the same track twice in the same playlist is allowed. Considering the following scenario: A playlist “Antarctica” contains Song1.mp3
If a user selects 3 tracks, Song1.mp3, Song2.mp3, Song3.mp3 and adds them to the playlist “Antarctica”. Playlist “Antarctica” will contain, the following: Song1.mp3, Song1.mp3, Song2.mp3 and Song3.mp3.

3.16.2 Call flow

Insert below a sequence diagram (ping pong) diagram in context to a complete call flow or transaction with numbered arrows and some description explaining the sequence as appropriate.

3.16.3 Version Impact Summary

Summarize the different versions of this operation that are in production or deleted by the current release of this service.
Service Version
Major or Minor Impact
Changes Introduced by this Version
1
Major
Initial Release

3.16.4 Authentication and Authorization

Describe OAuth model applicable to this operation.
Authorization Model
Subscriber Authorization required?
OAuth Scope Value
Brief Description
OAuth
authorization_code
Yes
LOCKER
  1. Redirect user to AT&T authorization page to capture User consent
  2. Obtain Token obtained using authorization code issued by the gateway alonf the client key and secret by making an Oauth token call with GrantType=authorization_code

3.16.5 Representation Formats

In the table below, describe supported representation formats for the request and response body. Where different versions support different formats, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table.
Direction
Supported Representation Formats
Request
XML, JSON
Response
XML, JSON

3.16.6 Input Parameters

In the table below, describe input parameters. Where different versions support different input parameters, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table. The allowed values for the Location in Request column are: Header, Resource URI, Body or Query Parameter.
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
accept
String
No
Specifies the format of the body of the response. Valid values are:
  • application/json
  • application/xml
The default value is application/json. Per rfc2616: "If no Accept header field is present, then it is assumed that the client accepts all tracks types." By default our services return application/json.
Normal Accept header processing rules shall be followed according to rfc2616.
Note: If there is no entity body in a normal successful response, this parameter can still be specified to determine the format in the case of an error response message.
Header
accept-encoding
String
No
Specifies the accept encoding format. When this header is present, the gateway should compress the response to indicate the client that response is in compressed format. Valid values are: gzip
Header
authorization
String
Yes
Specifies the authorization type and token. "Bearer" + OAuth Token – access_token. If the authorization header is missing, the system shall return an HTTP 400 Invalid Request message. If the token is invalid the system shall return an HTTP 401 Unauthorized message with a WWW-Authenticate HTTP header.
Header
content-length
Integer
No
Specifies the length of the content in octets. This header parameter is only required for the non-streaming request.
Header
content-type
String
Yes
Specifies the type of content of the body of the entity. Must be set to one of the following values:
  • application/json
  • application/xml
Header
playlistId
Integer
Yes
Specifies the id of the playlist where the files will be placed.
URI Path
trackIds
Object
Yes
Contains the tracks that are to be added
Body
id
Array
Yes
Specifies the ids of the track that is to be added to the playlist.
Body
index
Integer
No
Specifies the absolute position where you want to place the new content.
Default is to put at the end of the playlist.
Body

3.16.6.1 Request – Example (Add tracks to an playlist in XML)

This demonstrates how to add tracks to an playlist, and specifying the request to be in XML.
POST /locker/v1/playlists/3433435/tracks HTTP/1.1 


host: api.att.com


content-type: application/xml


authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678


accept: application/xml




<trackIds>


    <id>112</id>


    <id>125</id>


    <index>1</index>  	


</trackIds>

3.16.6.2 Request – Example (Add tracks to an playlist in JSON)

This demonstrates how to add tracks to an playlist, and specifying the request to be in JSON.
POST /locker/v1/folders/3433435/files HTTP/1.1 


Host: api.att.com


content-type: application/json


authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678


accept: application/json




{


  "trackIds": {


    "id": [112,125],


    "index": 1


  }


}

3.16.7 Output Parameters

In the table below, describe output parameters. Where different versions support different output parameters, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table. Note: ‘consent’ refers to end user consent which may need to be obtained before data is returned,
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
content-type
String
Yes
Specifies the type of content of the body of the entity. Must be set to one of the following values:
  • application/json
  • aplication/xml
Note: If there is no entity body in a normal successful response, this parameter is still needed to specify the format in the case of an error response message.
Header
content-encoding
String
No
Specifies the type of encoding used on the data. Supported values are: identity or gzip
Note: If there is no entity body in a normal successful response, this parameter is still needed to specify the format in the case of an error response message.
Header

3.16.7.1 Response – Example (Add tracks to an playlist in XML)

This shows the response to an add tracks to playlist request.
HTTP/1.1 204 No Content


date: Thu, 04 Jun 2010 02:51:59 GMT

3.16.8 HTTP Response Codes

List expected response codes (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
Code
Reason Phrase
Description
204
No Content
Successful response and the response does not include an entity.
400
Bad Request
Many possible reasons not specified by the other codes.
401
Authentication Error
Authentication failed or was not provided.
403
Forbidden
Access permission error.
404
Not Found
The server has not found anything matching the Request-URI. No indication is given of whether the condition is temporary or permanent.
405
Method Not Allowed
A request was made of a resource using a request method not supported by that resource (e.g., using PUT on a REST resource that only supports POST).
408
Request Timeout
The client did not produce a request within the time that the server was prepared to wait. The client MAY repeat the request without modifications at any later time.
411
Length Required
The Content-Length header was not specified.
413
Request Entity Too Large
The size of the request body exceed the maximum size permitted.
415
Unsupported Media Type
The request is in a format not supported by the requested resource for the requested method.
500
Internal Server Error
The server encountered an internal error or timed out; please retry.
503
Service Unavailable
The server is currently unable to receive requests; please retry.

3.16.9 Service Exceptions

List the service exceptions generated by the operation (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
MessageId
Text
Variables
Parent HTTP Code

A service error has occurred. Error code is <Error Explanation>
Error Explanation : <content here>
400
SVC0002
Invalid input value for Message part <part name>
part name : name of the input parameter that resulted in the error
400

A policy error occurred. For example, rate limit error, authentication and authorization error.

3.17 Operation: Get Tracks Listing

3.17.1 Functional Behavior

Describe the functional behavior provided by this operation. Also add here any special considerations, assumptions, and dependencies for this particular operation
Lists all tracks belonging to a user.

3.17.2 Call flow

Insert below a sequence diagram (ping pong) diagram in context to a complete call flow or transaction with numbered arrows and some description explaining the sequence as appropriate.

3.17.3 Version Impact Summary

Summarize the different versions of this operation that are in production or deleted by the current release of this service.
Service Version
Major or Minor Impact
Changes Introduced by this Version
1
Major
Initial Release

3.17.4 Authentication and Authorization

Describe OAuth model applicable to this operation.
Authorization Model
Subscriber Authorization required?
OAuth Scope Value
Brief Description
OAuth
authorization_code
Yes
LOCKER
  1. Redirect user to AT&T authorization page to capture User consent
  2. Obtain Token obtained using authorization code issued by the gateway alonf the client key and secret by making an Oauth token call with GrantType=authorization_code

3.17.5 Representation Formats

In the table below, describe supported representation formats for the request and response body. Where different versions support different formats, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table.
Direction
Supported Respresentation Formats
Request
N/A
Response
XML, JSON

3.17.6 Input Parameters

In the table below, describe input parameters. Where different versions support different input parameters, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table. The allowed values for the Location in Request column are: Header, Resource URI, Body or Query Parameter.
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
accept
String
No
Specifies the format of the body of the response. Valid values are:
  • application/json
  • application/xml
The default value is application/json. Per rfc2616: "If no Accept header field is present, then it is assumed that the client accepts all media types." By default our services return application/json.
Normal Accept header processing rules shall be followed according to rfc2616.
Note: If there is no entity body in a normal successful response, this parameter can still be specified to determine the format in the case of an error response message.
Header
accept-encoding
String
No
Specifies the accept encoding format. When this header is present, the gateway should compress the response to indicate the client that response is in compressed format. Valid values are: gzip
Header
authorization
String
Yes
Specifies the authorization type and token. "Bearer" + OAuth Token – access_token. If the authorization header is missing, the system shall return an HTTP 400 Invalid Request message. If the token is invalid the system shall return an HTTP 401 Unauthorized message with a WWW-Authenticate HTTP header.
Header
query
String
No
URL encoded search query. We recommend using the UTF-8 encoding scheme to obtain the bytes for unsafe characters. This is in keeping with the following W3 recommendation: http://www.w3.org/TR/html40/appendix/notes.html#non-ascii-chars
Query Parameter
before
String
No
Files added before or exactly at timestamp, if empty no lower time limit for search period, example: 2010-07-30
Query Parameter
after
String
No
Files added after or exactly at timestamp, if empty no lower time limit for search period, example: 2010-07-30
Query Parameter
limit
Integer
Yes
Specifies the max number of results returned.
Query Parameter
offset
Integer
Yes
Specifies the scroll set pointer on the results collection.
Query Parameter
orderBy
String
No
Specifies the sorting criteria. Valid values are: name, creationdate, contentsize, author
Default: name
Query Parameter
order
String
No
Specifies the sorting order. Valid values are: asc, desc
Default: asc
Query Parameter
isCompressed
Boolean
No
Specifies that the result set will only contain the name of the media instead of the full details if set to true. Otherwise default result set.
Query Parameter

3.17.6.1 Request – Example (Get a tracks listing)

This demonstrates how to get a tracks listing.
GET /locker/v1/tracks?limit=20&offset=10&orderBy=author&order=desc HTTP/1.1 


host: api.att.com


authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678


accept: application/xml


accept-encoding: gzip

3.17.7 Output Parameters

In the table below, describe output parameters. Where different versions support different output parameters, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table. Note: ‘consent’ refers to end user consent which may need to be obtained before data is returned,
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
content-type
String
Yes
Specifies the type of content of the body of the entity. Must be set to one of the following values:
  • applciation/json
  • application/xml
Header
content-encoding
String
No
Specifies the type of encoding used on the data. Supported values are: identity or gzip
Header
content
Object
Yes
Specifies the object that contains the response info.
Body
total
Integer
Yes
Specifies the total number of tracks in a user’s account
Body
count
Integer
Yes
Specifies the number of tracks returned in the response
Body
tracks
Object
Yes
Specifies the object that contains the tracks list.
Body
track
Object
Yes
Specifies the object that contains the tracks information
Body

Track Object

This table describes the parameters that belong to the track object
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
id
String
Yes
Specifies the Id of the content object
body
name
String
Yes
Specifies the name of content object
body
creationDate
String
Yes
Specifies the date of track creation in the system.
body
description
String
Yes
Specifies the description of the entry
body
mimeType
String
Yes
Specifies the mime type of track i.e. “video/mp4; charset=binary”
body
url
AnyURI
Yes
Specifies the download URL
body
format
String
Yes
Specifies the computed track format.
body
extension
String
Yes
Specifies the track extension
body
index
Integer
Yes
Index of the track in the playlist
body
streamUrl
Is streaming supported in this version???
AnyURI
Yes
Specifies the URL for streaming a video
body
shareCodes
Array
Yes
Specifies an array of Sshare codes that this track object belongs to.
body
tags
Array
Yes
Specifies an array of Ttags that this track object is associated to.
body
accessBlocked
Boolean
Yes
Specifies whether or not the track can be accessed
body
metadataList
Array
Yes
Contains the metadata objects
Body
metadata
Object
Yes
Contains the metadata information
body
playlists
Array
Yes
Specifies an array that contains playlist objects.
body
playlist
Object
Yes
Contains the playlist information.
Body
av
Object
Yes
Contains the AV information.
body
collections
Object
Yes
Contains collection of objects
Body
previews
Object
Yes
Contains the previews information
Body

AV Object

This table describes the parameters that belong to the av object
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
status
String
No
Specifies the status, and the options are: pending, error, ok, infected, riskware, spyware, adware
body
detection
String
No
Specifies the detection name if infected, missing otherwise
body
message
String
No
Specifies the message for specifying state in case not clean, key missing otherwise.
body

Preview Object

This table describes the parameters that belong to the preview object
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
format
String
Yes
Specifies the format of preview
body
url
AnyURI
Yes
Specifies the download url
body
width
Integer
Yes
Specifies the width of preview (image/video)
body
height
Integer
Yes
Specifies the height of preview (image/video)
body
bitrate
Integer
Yes
Specifies the preview bitrate (audio)
body
channels
Integer
Yes
Specifies the audio channels (audio)
body

This table describes the parameters that belong to the metadata object

Data Type
Req?
Brief description

String
No
Specifies the Song album
body

String
No
Specifies the Artist
body

Integer
No
Specifies the audio bitrate in kb/s
body

Integer
No
Specifies the audio channels
body

String
No
Specifies the audio codec
body

Integer
No

body

String
No
Specifies the author
body

Hex
No
Specifies the background color eg: ff11aa
body

Integer
No
Specifies the character count
body

String
No
Specifies the color depth eg: 8-bit
body

String
No
Specifies the color space eg: cmyk
body

String
No
Specifies the compression eg: jpeg200
body

String
No
Specifies the dimension <width>x<height>
body

Boolean
No
Specifies the drm eg: 1 means file is drm protected
body

Float
No
Specifies the duration in seconds
body

String
No

body

body

Integer
No
Specifies the iso
body

String
No

body
