Integer
No
Specifies the orientation range: 0 to 8
body

3.17.7.1 Response – Example (Get tracks listing in XML)

This shows the response to a Get tracks listing in XML format.
HTTP/1.1 200 OK


content-type: application/xml 


content-length: 929 


date: Thu, 04 Jun 2010 02:51:59 GMT




<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>


<content>


    <count>2</count>


    <total>2</total>


    <tracks>


        <track>


            <accessBlocked>false</accessBlocked>


            <av>


                <status>ok</status>


            </av>


            <contentSize>4102272</contentSize>


            <creationDate>05-02-2011 14:06:49 +0000</creationDate>


            <description></description>


            <extension>mp3</extension>


            <format>mpeg</format>


            <id>109</id>


            <metadataList>


                <metadata>


                    <name>Album</name>


                    <value>Final Fantasy VIII Piano Collection</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>Artist</name>


                    <value>FF8</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>AudioBitrate</name>


                    <value>160</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>AudioCodec</name>


                    <value>MPEG Audio</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>Author</name>


                    <value>FF8</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>Drm</name>


                    <value>0</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>Duration</name>


                    <value>206.316</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>Genre</name>


                    <value>Game</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>Title</name>


                    <value>Eyes on Me</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>TrackNumber</name>


                    <value>02</value>


                </metadata>


            </metadataList>


            <name>I love M&amp;M's.mp3</name>


            <collections/>


            <previews>


                <preview>


                    <format>jpg</format>


                    <height>240</height>


                    <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/track/?content_id=109&amp;ticket=ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1&amp;preview=320x240xjpg</url>


                    <width>320</width>


                </preview>


                <preview>


                    <format>jpg</format>


                    <height>90</height>


                    <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/track/?content_id=109&amp;ticket=ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1&amp;preview=120x90xjpg</url>


                    <width>120</width>


                </preview>


                <preview>


                    <format>jpg</format>


                    <height>480</height>


                    <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/track/?content_id=109&amp;ticket=ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1&amp;preview=640x480xjpg</url>


                    <width>640</width>


                </preview>


                <preview>


                    <bitrate>1536k</bitrate>


                    <channels>2</channels>


                    <format>wav</format>


                    <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/track/?content_id=109&amp;ticket=ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1&amp;preview=1536kx2xwav</url>


                </preview>


                <preview>


                    <bitrate>32k</bitrate>


                    <channels>1</channels>


                    <format>aac</format>


                    <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/track/?content_id=109&amp;ticket=ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1&amp;preview=32kx1xaac</url>


                </preview>


                <preview>


                    <bitrate>64k</bitrate>


                    <channels>2</channels>


                    <format>aac</format>


                    <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/track/?content_id=109&amp;ticket=ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1&amp;preview=64kx2xaac</url>


                </preview>


            </previews>


            <shareCodes/>


            <sharingBlocked>false</sharingBlocked>


            <streamUrl>


                rtsp://streaming.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1/109_pc.3gp


            </streamUrl>


            <tags/>


            <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/track/?content_id=109&amp;ticket=ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1</url>


        </track>


        <track>


            <accessBlocked>false</accessBlocked>


            <av>


                <status>ok</status>


            </av>


            <contentSize>4010112</contentSize>


            <creationDate>05-02-2011 14:07:24 +0000</creationDate>


            <description>UPDATING DESCRIPTION</description>


            <extension>mp3</extension>


            <format>mpeg; charset=binary</format>


            <id>110</id>


            <metadataList>


                <metadata>


                    <name>Album</name>


                    <value>OCHO</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>Artist</name>


                    <value>Gian Marco</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>AudioBitrate</name>


                    <value>128</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>AudioCodec</name>


                    <value>MPEG Audio</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>Author</name>


                    <value>Gian Marco</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>Drm</name>


                    <value>0</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>Duration</name>


                    <value>250.488</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>Genre</name>


                    <value>Pop</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>Title</name>


                    <value>Vientos Del Sur</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>TrackNumber</name>


                    <value>1</value>


                </metadata>


            </metadataList>


            <name>Vientos Del Sur.mp3</name>


            <collections/>


            <previews>


                <preview>


                    <bitrate>1536k</bitrate>


                    <channels>2</channels>


                    <format>wav</format>


                    <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/track/?content_id=110&amp;ticket=ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1&amp;preview=1536kx2xwav</url>


                </preview>


                <preview>


                    <bitrate>32k</bitrate>


                    <channels>1</channels>


                    <format>aac</format>


                    <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/track/?content_id=110&amp;ticket=ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1&amp;preview=32kx1xaac</url>


                </preview>


                <preview>


                    <bitrate>64k</bitrate>


                    <channels>2</channels>


                    <format>aac</format>


                    <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/track/?content_id=110&amp;ticket=ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1&amp;preview=64kx2xaac</url>


                </preview>


            </previews>


            <shareCodes/>


            <sharingBlocked>false</sharingBlocked>


            <streamUrl>


                rtsp://streaming.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1/110_pc.3gp


            </streamUrl>


            <tags/>


            <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/track/?content_id=110&amp;ticket=ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1</url>


        </track>


    </tracks>


</content>

3.17.7.2 Response – Example (Get file listing in JSON)

This shows the response to a Get tracks listing in JSON format
HTTP/1.1 200 OK 


content-type: application/json 


content-length: 624 


date: Thu, 04 Jun 2010 02:51:59 GMT




{


  "content": {


    "count": 2,


    "total": 2,


    "tracks": {


      "track": [


        {


          "accessBlocked": false,


          "av": { "status": "ok" },


          "contentSize": 4102272,

          "format": "mpeg",


          "id": 109,

    }


  }


}

3.17.8 HTTP Response Codes

List expected response codes (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
Code
Reason Phrase
Description
200
OK
Successful response
400
Bad Request
Many possible reasons not specified by the other codes.
401
Authentication Error
Authentication failed or was not provided.
403
Forbidden
Access permission error.
404
Not Found
The server has not found anything matching the Request-URI. No indication is given of whether the condition is temporary or permanent.
414
Request-URI Too Long
The server is refusing to service the request because the Request-URI is longer than the server is willing to interpret.
500
Internal Server Error
The server encountered an internal error or timed out; please retry.
503
Service Unavailable
The server is currently unable to receive requests; please retry.

3.17.9 Service Exceptions

List the service exceptions generated by the operation (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
MessageId
Text
Variables
Parent HTTP Code
SVC0001
A service error has occurred. Error code is <Error Explanation>
Error Explanation : <content here>
400
SVC0002
Invalid input value for Message part <part name>
part name : name of the input parameter that resulted in the error
400
SVC0002
Invalid input value for Message part offset. The offset must be greater than or equal to zero and less than the total number of objects
N/A
400
SVC0003
Invalid input value for Message part <part name>, valid values are <part values>
part value : value of input parameter that was found to be in error.
400

3.17.10 Policy Exceptions

List the policy exceptions generated by the operation (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
MessageId
Text
Variables
Parent HTTP Code
POL0001
A policy error occurred. For example, rate limit error, authentication and authorization error.
N/A
401,403
POL0001
Submitted limit is greater than the maximum allowed limit size or less than or equal to zero
N/A
403
POL1009
User has not been provisioned for %1
System that hasn’t been provisioned
403

3.18 Operation: Delete Playlist Tracks

3.18.1 Functional Behavior

Describe the functional behavior provided by this operation. Also add here any special considerations, assumptions, and dependencies for this particular operation
Remove tracks from an playlist belonging to a user.

3.18.2 Call flow

Insert below a sequence diagram (ping pong) diagram in context to a complete call flow or transaction with numbered arrows and some description explaining the sequence as appropriate.

3.18.3 Version Impact Summary

Summarize the different versions of this operation that are in production or deleted by the current release of this service.
Service Version
Major or Minor Impact
Changes Introduced by this Version
1
Major
Initial Release

3.18.4 Authentication and Authorization

Describe OAuth model applicable to this operation.
Authorization Model
Subscriber Authorization required?
OAuth Scope Value
Brief Description
OAuth
authorization_code
Yes
LOCKER
  1. Redirect user to AT&T authorization page to capture User consent
  2. Obtain Token obtained using authorization code issued by the gateway alonf the client key and secret by making an Oauth token call with GrantType=authorization_code

3.18.5 Representation Formats

In the table below, describe supported representation formats for the request and response body. Where different versions support different formats, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table.
Direction
Supported Representation Formats
Request
N/A
Response
XML, JSON

3.18.6 Input Parameters

In the table below, describe input parameters. Where different versions support different input parameters, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table. The allowed values for the Location in Request column are: Header, Resource URI, Body or Query Parameter.
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
accept
String
No
Specifies the format of the body of the response. Valid values are:
  • application/json
  • application/xml
The default value is application/json. Per rfc2616: "If no Accept header field is present, then it is assumed that the client accepts all tracks types." By default our services return application/json.
Normal Accept header processing rules shall be followed according to rfc2616.
Note: If there is no entity body in a normal successful response, this parameter can still be specified to determine the format in the case of an error response message.
Header
accept-encoding
String
No
Specifies the accept encoding format. When this header is present, the gateway should compress the response to indicate the client that response is in compressed format. Valid values are: gzip
Header
authorization
String
Yes
Specifies the authorization type and token. "Bearer" + OAuth Token – access_token. If the authorization header is missing, the system shall return an HTTP 400 Invalid Request message. If the token is invalid the system shall return an HTTP 401 Unauthorized message with a WWW-Authenticate HTTP header.
Header
playlistId
Integer
Yes
Specifies the id of the playlist for which the track will be removed from.
URI Path
trackIds
Integer
Yes
Specifies the ids of the tracks that need to be removed from the folder.
Query Parameter

3.18.6.1 Request – Example (Delete 2 tracks from an playlist)

This demonstrates how to delete 2 tracks from an playlist.
DELETE /locker/v1/playlists/2234456/tracks?trackIds=62588%2C55888 HTTP/1.1 


host: api.att.com


authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678


accept: application/xml

3.18.7 Output Parameters

In the table below, describe output parameters. Where different versions support different output parameters, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table. Note: ‘consent’ refers to end user consent which may need to be obtained before data is returned,
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
content-type
String
Yes
Specifies the type of content of the body of the entity. Must be set to one of the following values:
  • application/xml
  • application/json
Note: If there is no entity body in a normal successful response, this parameter is still needed to specify the format in the case of an error response message.
Header
content-encoding
string
No
Specifies the type of encoding used on the data. Supported values are: identity or gzip
Note: If there is no entity body in a normal successful response, this parameter is still needed to specify the format in the case of an error response message.
Header

3.18.7.1 Response – Example (Successful response to deleting tracks from an playlist)

This shows the response to deleting tracks from a playlist
HTTP/1.1 204 No Content


content-length: 0


date: Thu, 04 Jun 2010 02:51:59 GMT

3.18.8 HTTP Response Codes

List expected response codes (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
Code
Reason Phrase
Description
204
No Content
Successful response and the response does not include an entity.
400
Bad Request
Many possible reasons not specified by the other codes.
401
Authentication Error
Authentication failed or was not provided.
403
Forbidden
Access permission error.
404
Not Found
The server has not found anything matching the Request-URI. No indication is given of whether the condition is temporary or permanent.
414
Request-URI Too Long
The server is refusing to service the request because the Request-URI is longer than the server is willing to interpret.
500
Internal Server Error
The server encountered an internal error or timed out; please retry.
503
Service Unavailable
The server is currently unable to receive requests; please retry.

3.18.9 Service Exceptions

List the service exceptions generated by the operation (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
MessageId
Text
Variables
Parent HTTP Code

A service error has occurred. Error code is <Error Explanation>
Error Explanation : <content here>
400
SVC0002
Invalid input value for Message part <part name>
part name : name of the input parameter that resulted in the error
400

3.18.10 Policy Exceptions

List the policy exceptions generated by the operation (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
MessageId

POL0001

System that hasn’t been provisioned
403

3.19 Operation: Update Track

3.19.1 Functional Behavior

Describe the functional behavior provided by this operation. Also add here any special considerations, assumptions, and dependencies for this particular operation
Modifies a specific track object’s information. By default if a user attempts to update a track type with the name of a track type that already exists, system will throw an exception as it is not allowed.

3.19.2 Call flow

Insert below a sequence diagram (ping pong) diagram in context to a complete call flow or transaction with numbered arrows and some description explaining the sequence as appropriate.

3.19.3 Version Impact Summary

Summarize the different versions of this operation that are in production or deleted by the current release of this service.
Service Version
Major or Minor Impact
Changes Introduced by this Version
1
Major
Initial Release

3.19.4 Authentication and Authorization

Describe OAuth model applicable to this operation.
Authorization Model
Subscriber Authorization required?
OAuth Scope Value
Brief Description
OAuth
authorization_code
Yes
LOCKER
  1. Redirect user to AT&T authorization page to capture User consent
  2. Obtain Token obtained using authorization code issued by the gateway alonf the client key and secret by making an Oauth token call with GrantType=authorization_code

3.19.5 Representation Formats

In the table below, describe supported representation formats for the request and response body. Where different versions support different formats, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table.
Direction
Supported Respresentation Formats
Request
XML, JSON
Response
XML, JSON

3.19.6 Input Parameters

In the table below, describe input parameters. Where different versions support different input parameters, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table. The allowed values for the Location in Request column are: Header, Resource URI, Body or Query Parameter.
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
accept
String
No
Specifies the format of the body of the response. Valid values are:
  • application/json
  • application/xml
The default value is application/json. Per rfc2616: "If no Accept header field is present, then it is assumed that the client accepts all track types." By default our services return application/json.
Normal Accept header processing rules shall be followed according to rfc2616.
Note: If there is no entity body in a normal successful response, this parameter can still be specified to determine the format in the case of an error response message.
Header
accept-encoding
String
No
Specifies the accept encoding format. When this header is present, the gateway should compress the response to indicate the client that response is in compressed format. Valid values are: gzip
Header
authorization
String
Yes
Specifies the authorization type and token. "Bearer" + OAuth Token – access_token. If the authorization header is missing, the system shall return an HTTP 400 Invalid Request message. If the token is invalid the system shall return an HTTP 401 Unauthorized message with a WWW-Authenticate HTTP header.
Header
content-length
Integer
No
Specifies the length of the content in octets. This header parameter is only required for the non-streaming request.
Header
content-type
String
Yes
Specifies the type of content of the body of the entity. Must be set to one of the following values:
  • application/json
  • application/xml
Header
trackId
Integer
Yes
Specifies the id of the track that needs to be updated
URI Path
track
Object
Yes
Contains the response information.
Body
name
String
No
Specifies the name of the track
Body
description
String
No
Specifies the description of the track
Body
Need to check if the whole Content.File object is valid here!!

3.19.6.1 Request – Example (Update a track using XML)

This demonstrates how to update a track using XML.
PATCH /locker/v1/tracks/2234456 HTTP/1.1 


host: api.att.com


authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678


accept: application/xml


content-type: application/xml




<track>


      <description>I LIKE THIS NEW DESCRIPTION better.</description>


</track>

3.19.6.2 Request – Example (Update a track using JSON)

This demonstrates how to update a track using JSON.
PATCH /locker/v1/tracks/2234456 HTTP/1.1 


host: api.att.com


content-type: application/json


authorization: Bearer 38C2399A23999


accept: application/json




{


  "track": { 


      "name": "my_new_file_name"


  }


}

3.19.7 Output Parameters

In the table below, describe output parameters. Where different versions support different output parameters, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table. Note: ‘consent’ refers to end user consent which may need to be obtained before data is returned,
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
content-type
string
yes
Specifies the type of content of the body of the entity. Must be set to one of the following values:
  • audio/wav (or audio/x-wav)
  • audio/amr
Header
content-encoding
string
No
Specifies the type of encoding used on the data. Supported values are: identity or gzip
Header
track
object
Yes
Contains the response information
Body

Track Object

This table describes the parameters that belong to the track object
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
id
String
Yes
Specifies the Id of the content object
body
name
String
Yes
Specifies the name of content object
body
creationDate
String
Yes
Specifies the date of track creation in the system.
body
description
String
Yes
Specifies the description of the entry
body
mimeType
String
Yes
Specifies the mime type of track i.e. “video/mp4; charset=binary”
body
url
AnyURI
Yes
Specifies the download URL
body
format
String
Yes
Specifies the computed track format.
body
extension
String
Yes
Specifies the track extension
body
index
Integer
Yes
Index of the track in the playlist
body
streamUrl
Is streaming supported in this version???
AnyURI
Yes
Specifies the URL for streaming a video
body
shareCodes
Array
Yes
Specifies an array of Sshare codes that this track object belongs to.
body
tags
Array
Yes
Specifies an array of Ttags that this track object is associated to.
body
accessBlocked
Boolean
Yes
Specifies whether or not the track can be accessed
body
metadataList
Array
Yes
Contains the metadata objects
Body
metadata
Object
Yes
Contains the metadata information
body
playlists
Array
Yes
Specifies an array that contains playlist objects.
body
playlist
Object
Yes
Contains the playlist information.
Body
av
Object
Yes
Contains the AV information.
body
collections
Object
Yes
Contains collection of objects
Body
previews
Object
Yes
Contains the previews information
Body

AV Object

This table describes the parameters that belong to the av object
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
status
String
No
Specifies the status, and the options are: pending, error, ok, infected, riskware, spyware, adware
body
detection
String
No
Specifies the detection name if infected, missing otherwise
body
message
String
No
Specifies the message for specifying state in case not clean, key missing otherwise.
body

Preview Object

This table describes the parameters that belong to the preview object
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
format
String
Yes
Specifies the format of preview
body
url
AnyURI
Yes
Specifies the download url
body
width
Integer
Yes
Specifies the width of preview (image/video)
body
height
Integer
Yes
Specifies the height of preview (image/video)
body
bitrate
Integer
Yes
Specifies the preview bitrate (audio)
body
channels
Integer
Yes
Specifies the audio channels (audio)
body

Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
album
String
No
Specifies the Song album
body

String
No
Specifies the Artist
body

Integer
No
Specifies the audio bitrate in kb/s
body

Integer
No
Specifies the audio channels
body
audiocCodec
String
No
Specifies the audio codec
body
audioFrequency
Integer
No
Specifies the audio frequency in hz
body
author
String
No
Specifies the author
body
backgroundColor
Hex
No
Specifies the background color eg: ff11aa
body
characterCount
Integer
No
Specifies the character count
body
colorDepth
String
No
Specifies the color depth eg: 8-bit
body
colorSpace
String
No
Specifies the color space eg: cmyk
body
compression
String
No
Specifies the compression eg: jpeg200
body
dimension
String
No
Specifies the dimension <width>x<height>
body
drm
Boolean
No
Specifies the drm eg: 1 means file is drm protected
body
duration
Float
No
Specifies the duration in seconds
body
fnumber
rename?
String
No
Specifies the fnumber eg: f/4.0
body
focalLength
Float
No
Specifies the focal length in millimeters
body
genre
String
No
Specifies the genre
body
geometry
String
No
Specifies the geometry “raster” or “vector”
body
interlace
String
No
Specifies the interlace eg: line
body
iso
what is this?
Integer
No
Specifies the iso
body
language
String
No
Specifies the language
body
lineCount
Integer
No
Specifies the line count
body
make
String
No
Specifies the make
body
orientation
Integer
No
Specifies the orientation range: 0 to 8
body

3.19.7.1 Response – Example (Update track response in XML)

This shows the response to a track update in XML format.
HTTP/1.1 200 OK


date: Wed, 27 Apr 2011 14:11:31 GMT


content-length:539


content-type: application/xml




<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>


<track>


    <accessBlocked>false</accessBlocked>


    <av>


        <status>ok</status>


    </av>


    <contentSize>4102272</contentSize>


    <creationDate>05-02-2011 14:06:49 +0000</creationDate>


    <description>UPDATING DESCRIPTION</description>


    <extension>mp3</extension>


    <format>mpeg</format>


    <id>109</id>


    <metadataList>


        <metadata>


            <name>Album</name>


            <value>Final Fantasy VIII Piano Collection</value>


        </metadata>


        <metadata>


            <name>Artist</name>


            <value>FF8</value>


        </metadata>


        <metadata>


            <name>AudioBitrate</name>


            <value>160</value>


        </metadata>


        <metadata>


            <name>AudioCodec</name>


            <value>MPEG Audio</value>


        </metadata>


        <metadata>


            <name>Author</name>


            <value>FF8</value>


        </metadata>


        <metadata>


            <name>Drm</name>


            <value>0</value>


        </metadata>


        <metadata>


            <name>Duration</name>


            <value>206.316</value>


        </metadata>


        <metadata>


            <name>Genre</name>


            <value>Game</value>


        </metadata>


        <metadata>


            <name>Title</name>


            <value>Eyes on Me</value>


        </metadata>


        <metadata>


            <name>TrackNumber</name>


            <value>02</value>


        </metadata>


    </metadataList>


    <name>I love M&amp;M's.mp3</name>


    <collections>


        <playlists>


            <count>1</count>


            <creationDate>05-04-2011 18:48:47 +0000</creationDate>


            <description>Old School</description>


            <id>797</id>


            <name>Album</name>


            <size>4102272</size>


        </playlists>


    </collections>


    <previews>


        <preview>


            <format>jpg</format>


            <height>240</height>


            <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/track/?content_id=109&amp;ticket=ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1&amp;preview=320x240xjpg</url>


            <width>320</width>


        </preview>


        <preview>


            <format>jpg</format>


            <height>90</height>


            <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/track/?content_id=109&amp;ticket=ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1&amp;preview=120x90xjpg</url>


            <width>120</width>


        </preview>


        <preview>


            <format>jpg</format>


            <height>480</height>


            <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/track/?content_id=109&amp;ticket=ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1&amp;preview=640x480xjpg</url>


            <width>640</width>


        </preview>


        <preview>


            <bitrate>1536k</bitrate>


            <channels>2</channels>


            <format>wav</format>


            <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/track/?content_id=109&amp;ticket=ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1&amp;preview=1536kx2xwav</url>


        </preview>


        <preview>


            <bitrate>32k</bitrate>


            <channels>1</channels>


            <format>aac</format>


            <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/track/?content_id=109&amp;ticket=ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1&amp;preview=32kx1xaac</url>


        </preview>


        <preview>


            <bitrate>64k</bitrate>


            <channels>2</channels>


            <format>aac</format>


            <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/track/?content_id=109&amp;ticket=ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1&amp;preview=64kx2xaac</url>


        </preview>


    </previews>


    <shareCodes/>


    <sharingBlocked>false</sharingBlocked>


    <streamUrl>rtsp://streaming.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1/109_pc.3gp


    </streamUrl>


    <tags/>


    <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/track/?content_id=109&amp;ticket=ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1</url>


</track>

3.19.7.2 Response – Example (Update track response in JSON)

This shows the response to a track update in JSON format.
HTTP/1.1 200 OK 


content-type: application/json 


content-length: 624 


date: Thu, 04 Jun 2010 02:51:59 GMT




{


  "track": {


   


    "accessBlocked": "false",


    "av": { "status": "ok" },


    "contentSize": "4102272",


    "creationDate": "05-02-2011 14:06:49 +0000",


    "description": "UPDATING DESCRIPTION",


    "extension": "mp3",


    "format": "mpeg",


    "id": "109",


    "metadataList": {


      "metadata": [


        {


          "name": "Album",


          "value": "Final Fantasy VIII Piano Collection"


        },


        {


          "name": "Artist",


          "value": "FF8"


        },


        {


          "name": "AudioBitrate",


          "value": "160"


        },


        {


          "name": "AudioCodec",


          "value": "MPEG Audio"


        },


        {


          "name": "Author",


          "value": "FF8"


        },


        {


          "name": "Drm",


          "value": "0"


        },


        {


          "name": "Duration",


          "value": "206.316"


        },


        {


          "name": "Genre",


          "value": "Game"


        },


        {


          "name": "Title",


          "value": "Eyes on Me"


        },


        {


          "name": "TrackNumber",


          "value": "02"


        }


      ]


    },


    "name": "I love M&M's.mp3",


    "collections": {


      "playlists": {


        "count": "1",


        "creationDate": "05-04-2011 18:48:47 +0000",


        "description": "Old School",


        "id": "797",


        "name": "Album",


        "size": "4102272"


      }


    },


    "previews": {


      "preview": [


        {


          "format": "jpg",


          "height": "240",


          "url": "https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/track/?content_id=109&ticket=ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1&preview=320x240xjpg",


          "width": "320"


        },


        {


          "format": "jpg",


          "height": "90",


          "url": "https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/track/?content_id=109&ticket=ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1&preview=120x90xjpg",


          "width": "120"


        },


        {


          "format": "jpg",


          "height": "480",


          "url": "https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/track/?content_id=109&ticket=ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1&preview=640x480xjpg",


          "width": "640"


        },


        {


          "bitrate": "1536k",


          "channels": "2",


          "format": "wav",


          "url": "https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/track/?content_id=109&ticket=ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1&preview=1536kx2xwav"


        },


        {


          "bitrate": "32k",


          "channels": "1",


          "format": "aac",


          "url": "https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/track/?content_id=109&ticket=ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1&preview=32kx1xaac"


        },


        {


          "bitrate": "64k",


          "channels": "2",


          "format": "aac",


          "url": "https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/track/?content_id=109&ticket=ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1&preview=64kx2xaac"


        }


      ]


    },


    "sharingBlocked": "false",


    "streamUrl": "rtsp://streaming.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1/109_pc.3gp


    ",


    "url": "https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/track/?content_id=109&ticket=ae34af29-8623-47f2-9fa6-ab47867d87c1"


  }


}

3.19.8 HTTP Response Codes

List expected response codes (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
Code
Reason Phrase
Description
200
OK
Successful response
400
Bad Request
Many possible reasons not specified by the other codes.
401
Authentication Error
Authentication failed or was not provided.
403
Forbidden
Access permission error.
404
Not Found
The server has not found anything matching the Request-URI. No indication is given of whether the condition is temporary or permanent.
411
Length Required
The Content-Length header was not specified.
413
Request Entity Too Large
The size of the request body exceed the maximum size permitted.
415
Unsupported Media Type
The request is in a format not supported by the requested resource for the requested method.
500
Internal Server Error
The server encountered an internal error or timed out; please retry.
503
Service Unavailable
The server is currently unable to receive requests; please retry.

3.19.9 Service Exceptions

List the service exceptions generated by the operation (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
MessageId
Text
Variables
Parent HTTP Code
SVC0001
A service error has occurred. Error code is <Error Explanation>
Error Explanation : <content here>
400
SVC0002
Invalid input value for Message part <part name>
part name : name of the input parameter that resulted in the error
400

3.19.10 Policy Exceptions

List the policy exceptions generated by the operation (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
MessageId
Text
Variables
Parent HTTP Code
POL0001
A policy error occurred. For example, rate limit error, authentication and authorization error.
N/A
401,403
POL1009
User has not been provisioned for %1
System that hasn’t been provisioned
403

3.20 Operation: Create Folder

3.20.1 Functional Behavior

Describe the functional behavior provided by this operation. Also add here any special considerations, assumptions, and dependencies for this particular operation
Creates a new folder for a user.

3.20.2 Call flow

Insert below a sequence diagram (ping pong) diagram in context to a complete call flow or transaction with numbered arrows and some description explaining the sequence as appropriate.

3.20.3 Version Impact Summary

Summarize the different versions of this operation that are in production or deleted by the current release of this service.
Service Version
Major or Minor Impact
Changes Introduced by this Version
1
Major
Initial Release

3.20.4 Authentication and Authorization

Describe OAuth model applicable to this operation.
Authorization Model
Subscriber Authorization required?
OAuth Scope Value
Brief Description
OAuth
authorization_code
Yes
LOCKER
  1. Redirect user to AT&T authorization page to capture User consent
  2. Obtain Token obtained using authorization code issued by the gateway alonf the client key and secret by making an Oauth token call with GrantType=authorization_code

3.20.5 Representation Formats

In the table below, describe supported representation formats for the request and response body. Where different versions support different formats, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table.
Direction
Supported Representation Formats
Request
XML, JSON
Response
XML, JSON

3.20.6 Input Parameters

In the table below, describe input parameters. Where different versions support different input parameters, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table. The allowed values for the Location in Request column are: Header, Resource URI, Body or Query Parameter.
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
accept
String
No
Specifies the format of the body of the response. Valid values are:
  • application/json
  • application/xml
The default value is application/json. Per rfc2616: "If no Accept header field is present, then it is assumed that the client accepts all media types." By default our services return application/json.
Normal Accept header processing rules shall be followed according to rfc2616.
Note: If there is no entity body in a normal successful response, this parameter can still be specified to determine the format in the case of an error response message.
Header
accept-encoding
String
No
Specifies the accept encoding format. When this header is present, the gateway should compress the response to indicate the client that response is in compressed format. Valid values are: gzip
Header
authorization
String
Yes
Specifies the authorization type and token. "Bearer" + OAuth Token – access_token. If the authorization header is missing, the system shall return an HTTP 400 Invalid Request message. If the token is invalid the system shall return an HTTP 401 Unauthorized message with a WWW-Authenticate HTTP header.
Header
content-length
Integer
No
Specifies the length of the content in octets. This header parameter is only required for the non-streaming request.
Header
content-type
String
Yes
Specifies the type of content of the body of the entity. Must be set to one of the following values:
  • application/json
  • application/xml
Header
folder
Object
Yes
Specifies the object that contains the folder information
Body
name
String
Yes
Specifies the name of playlist
Body
description
String
No
Specifies the description of the playlist
Body

3.20.6.1 Request – Example (Create a folder using XML body)

This demonstrates how to create a folder with a description.
POST /locker/v1/folders HTTP/1.1 


Host: api.att.com


content-type: application/xml


authorization: Bearer 38C2399A23999


accept: application/xml




<folder>


      <name>Bunch of random Files Folder</name>


      <description>Cuz i need space</description>


</folder>

3.20.6.2 Request – Example (Create a folder using JSON body)

This demonstrates how to create a folder with a description.. The response format will be in JSON.
POST /locker/v1/folders HTTP/1.1 


Host: api.att.com


content-type: application/json


authorization: Bearer 38C2399A23999


accept: application/json




{


    "folder": {


      "name": "Bunch of random Files Folder",


      "description": "Cuz i need space"


    }


}

3.20.7 Output Parameters

In the table below, describe output parameters. Where different versions support different output parameters, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table. Note: ‘consent’ refers to end user consent which may need to be obtained before data is returned,
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
content-type
String
Yes
Specifies the type of content of the body of the entity. Must be set to one of the following values:
  • application/xml
  • application/json
Header
location
AnyURI
Yes
Specifies the location of the newly created folder. This URI can be used to interact with the newly created resource. See Get Folder Contents for how the URI is structured.
Header
folder
Object
Yes
Specifies the object which contain folder information
Body

Folder Object

This table specifies the parameters that belong to the folder object
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
id
Could be an Integer???
String
Yes
Specifies the Id of the content object
body
name
Don't know if these are required or not
String
Yes
Specifies the name of content
body
creationDate
String
Yes
Specifies the date of file creation in the system.
body
size
Integer
Yes
Specifies the size of linked content (bytes)
body
description
String
Yes
Specifies the description of the entry
body
count
Integer
Yes
Specifies the mime type of file i.e. “video/mp4; charset=binary”
body

3.20.7.1 Response – Example (XML)

This shows the response to a folder creation in XML format.
HTTP/1.1 201 Created


Date: Wed, 27 Apr 2011 14:11:31 GMT


content-length: 223


content-type: application/xml


location: https://api.att.com/locker/v1/folders/856




<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>


<folder>


    <count>0</count>


    <creationDate>05-05-2011 14:17:27 +0000</creationDate>


    <description>Cuz i need space</description>


    <id>856</id>


    <name>Bunch of random Files Folder</name>


    <size>0</size>


</folder>

3.20.7.2 Response – Example (JSON)

This shows the response to a folder creation in JSON format
HTTP/1.1 201 Created


Date: Wed, 27 Apr 2011 14:11:31 GMT


content-length: 223


content-type: application/json


location: https://api.att.com/locker/v1/folders/856




{


    "folder": {


      "count": 0,


      "creationDate": "05-05-2011 14:17:27 +0000",


      "name": "Bunch of random Files Folder",


      "description": "Cuz i need space",


      "id": 856,


      "size": 0


    }


}

3.20.8 HTTP Response Codes

List expected response codes (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
Code
Reason Phrase
Description
201
Created
Successful response and resource was successfully created.
400
Bad Request
Many possible reasons not specified by the other codes.
401
Authentication Error
Authentication failed or was not provided.
403
Forbidden
Access permission error.
404
Not Found
The server has not found anything matching the Request-URI. No indication is given of whether the condition is temporary or permanent.
405
Method Not Allowed
A request was made of a resource using a request method not supported by that resource (e.g., using PUT on a REST resource that only supports POST).
408
Request Timeout
The client did not produce a request within the time that the server was prepared to wait. The client MAY repeat the request without modifications at any later time.
411
Length Required
The Content-Length header was not specified.
413
Request Entity Too Large
The size of the request body exceed the maximum size permitted.
414
Request-URI Too Long
The server is refusing to service the request because the Request-URI is longer than the server is willing to interpret.
415
Unsupported Media Type
The request is in a format not supported by the requested resource for the requested method.
500
Internal Server Error
The server encountered an internal error or timed out; please retry.
503
Service Unavailable
The server is currently unable to receive requests; please retry.

3.20.9 Service Exceptions

List the service exceptions generated by the operation (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
MessageId
Text
Variables
Parent HTTP Code
SVC0001
A service error has occurred. Error code is <Error Explanation>
Error Explanation : <content here>
400
SVC0002
Invalid input value for parameter 'name'. The value is already in use.
N/A
400
SVC0002
Invalid input value for Message part <part name>
part name : name of the input parameter that resulted in the error
400
SVC0003
Invalid input value for Message part <part name>, valid values are <part values>
part value : value of input parameter that was found to be in error.
400

List the policy exceptions generated by the operation (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):

Text
Variables

A policy error occurred. For example, rate limit error, authentication and authorization error.
N/A
401,403
POL1009
User has not been provisioned for %1
System that hasn’t been provisioned
403

3.21 Operation: Get Folder Listing

3.21.1 Functional Behavior

Describe the functional behavior provided by this operation. Also add here any special considerations, assumptions, and dependencies for this particular operation
Get the list of folders for a user.

3.21.2 Call flow

Insert below a sequence diagram (ping pong) diagram in context to a complete call flow or transaction with numbered arrows and some description explaining the sequence as appropriate.

3.21.3 Version Impact Summary

Summarize the different versions of this operation that are in production or deleted by the current release of this service.
Service Version
Major or Minor Impact
Changes Introduced by this Version
1
Major
Initial Release

3.21.4 Authentication and Authorization

Describe OAuth model applicable to this operation.
Authorization Model
Subscriber Authorization required?
OAuth Scope Value
Brief Description
OAuth
authorization_code
Yes
LOCKER
  1. Redirect user to AT&T authorization page to capture User consent
  2. Obtain Token obtained using authorization code issued by the gateway alonf the client key and secret by making an Oauth token call with GrantType=authorization_code

3.21.5 Representation Formats

In the table below, describe supported representation formats for the request and response body. Where different versions support different formats, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table.
Direction
Supported Respresentation Formats
Request
N/A
Response
XML, JSON

3.21.6 Input Parameters

In the table below, describe input parameters. Where different versions support different input parameters, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table. The allowed values for the Location in Request column are: Header, Resource URI, Body or Query Parameter.
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
accept
String
No
Specifies the format of the body of the response. Valid values are:
  • application/json
  • application/xml
The default value is application/json. Per rfc2616: "If no Accept header field is present, then it is assumed that the client accepts all media types." By default our services return application/json.
Normal Accept header processing rules shall be followed according to rfc2616.
Note: If there is no entity body in a normal successful response, this parameter can still be specified to determine the format in the case of an error response message.
Header
authorization
Changed “required” to Yes to align with IAM
String
Yes
Specifies the authorization type and token. "Bearer" + OAuth Token – access_token. If the authorization header is missing, the system shall return an HTTP 400 Invalid Request message. If the token is invalid the system shall return an HTTP 401 Unauthorized message with a WWW-Authenticate HTTP header.
Header
limit
Changed “required” to Yes to align with IAM
Integer
Yes
Specifies the max number of results returned.
Made it required, so no more default
Query Parameter
offset
Changed to “offset” from “marker” to align with IAM
Integer
Yes
Specifies the scroll set pointer on the results collection.
Query Parameter
orderBy
String
No
Specifies the sorting criteria. The valid values for sort are: name, creationDate, size, count
Can there be multiple?
Default: name
Query Parameter
order
String
No
The sorting order. The valid values are: asc, desc
Default: asc
how was this spec'ed in other APIs???
Query Parameter

3.21.6.1 Request – Example (Get folders based on query parameters)

This demonstrates how to get folders using GET, and specifying the response to be in XML.
GET /locker/v1/folders?limit=100&offset=15&orderBy=name&order=asc HTTP/1.1 


Host: api.att.com


authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678


accept: application/xml

3.21.7 Output Parameters

In the table below, describe output parameters. Where different versions support different output parameters, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table. Note: ‘consent’ refers to end user consent which may need to be obtained before data is returned,
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
content-type
String
Yes
Specifies the type of content of the body of the entity. Must be set to one of the following values:
  • audio/wav (or audio/x-wav)
  • audio/amr
Header
folders
Object
Yes
Specifies the object which contains the list of folders
Body
total
Integer
Yes
Specifies the total number of folders in a user’s account
Body
count
should this be renamed?
Integer
Yes
Specifies the number of folders returned in this response
Body
folder
Object
Yes
Specifies the object which contain folder information
Body

Folder Object

This table specifies the parameters that belong to the folder object
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
id
Could be an Integer???
String
Yes
Specifies the Id of the content object
body
name
Don't know if these are required or not
String
Yes
Specifies the name of content
body
creationDate
String
Yes
Specifies the date of file creation in the system.
body
size
Integer
Yes
Specifies the size of linked content (bytes)
body
description
String
Yes
Specifies the description of the entry
body
count
Integer
Yes
Specifies the mime type of file i.e. “video/mp4; charset=binary”
body

3.21.7.1 Response – Example (XML)

This shows the response to a Get All Folders in XML format.
HTTP/1.1 200 OK


Connection: close


Date: Wed, 27 Apr 2011 14:11:31 GMT


Content-Length: 223


Content-Type: application/xml




<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>


<folders>


    <folderCount>2</folderCount>


    <folder>


        <count>0</count>


        <creationDate>05-02-2011 19:11:44 +0000</creationDate>


        <description>Cuz i need space</description>


        <id>527</id>


        <name>Bunch of random Files Folder</name>


        <size>0</size>


    </folder>


    <folder>


        <count>0</count>


        <creationDate>05-05-2011 14:17:27 +0000</creationDate>


        <description>Cuz i need space</description>


        <id>856</id>


        <name>Bunch of random Files Folder</name>


        <size>0</size>


    </folder>


    <total>2</total>


</folders>

3.21.7.2 Response – Example (JSON)

This shows the response to a Get All Folders in JSON format.
HTTP/1.1 200 OK 


Content-Type: application/json 


Content-Length: 624 


Date: Thu, 04 Jun 2010 02:51:59 GMT




{


  "folders": {


    "folderCount": 2,


    "folder": [


      {


        "count": 0,


        "creationDate": "05-02-2011 19:11:44 +0000",


        "description": "Cuz i need space",


        "id": 527,


        "name": "Bunch of random Files Folder",


        "size": 0


      },


      {


        "count": 0,


        "creationDate": "05-05-2011 14:17:27 +0000",


        "description": "More space",


        "id": 856,


        "name": "More Bunch of random Files Folder",


        "size": 0


      }


    ],


    "total": 2


  }


}

3.21.8 HTTP Response Codes

List expected response codes (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
Code
Reason Phrase
Description
200
OK
Successful response
400
Bad Request
Many possible reasons not specified by the other codes.
401
Authentication Error
Authentication failed or was not provided.
403
Forbidden
Access permission error.
404
Not Found
The server has not found anything matching the Request-URI. No indication is given of whether the condition is temporary or permanent.
405
Method Not Allowed
A request was made of a resource using a request method not supported by that resource (e.g., using PUT on a REST resource that only supports POST).
408
Request Timeout
The client did not produce a request within the time that the server was prepared to wait. The client MAY repeat the request without modifications at any later time.
411
Length Required
The Content-Length header was not specified.
414
Request-URI Too Long
The server is refusing to service the request because the Request-URI is longer than the server is willing to interpret.
415
Unsupported Media Type
The request is in a format not supported by the requested resource for the requested method.
500
Internal Server Error
The server encountered an internal error or timed out; please retry.
503
Service Unavailable
The server is currently unable to receive requests; please retry.

3.22 Operation: Delete a Folder

3.22.1 Functional Behavior

Describe the functional behavior provided by this operation. Also add here any special considerations, assumptions, and dependencies for this particular operation
Delete an folder for a user.

3.22.2 Call flow

Insert below a sequence diagram (ping pong) diagram in context to a complete call flow or transaction with numbered arrows and some description explaining the sequence as appropriate.

3.22.3 Version Impact Summary

Summarize the different versions of this operation that are in production or deleted by the current release of this service.
Service Version
Major or Minor Impact
Changes Introduced by this Version
1
Major
Initial Release

3.22.4 Authentication and Authorization

Describe OAuth model applicable to this operation.
Authorization Model
Subscriber Authorization required?
OAuth Scope Value
Brief Description
OAuth
authorization_code
Yes
LOCKER
  1. Redirect user to AT&T authorization page to capture User consent
  2. Obtain Token obtained using authorization code issued by the gateway alonf the client key and secret by making an Oauth token call with GrantType=authorization_code

3.22.5 Representation Formats

In the table below, describe supported representation formats for the request and response body. Where different versions support different formats, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table.
Direction
Supported Respresentation Formats
Request
N/A
Response
XML, JSON

3.22.6 Input Parameters

In the table below, describe input parameters. Where different versions support different input parameters, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table. The allowed values for the Location in Request column are: Header, Resource URI, Body or Query Parameter.
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
accept
String
No
Specifies the format of the body of the response. Valid values are:
  • application/json
  • application/xml
The default value is application/json. Per rfc2616: "If no Accept header field is present, then it is assumed that the client accepts all media types." By default our services return application/json.
Normal Accept header processing rules shall be followed according to rfc2616.
Note: If there is no entity body in a normal successful response, this parameter can still be specified to determine the format in the case of an error response message.
Header
accept-encoding
String
No
Specifies the accept encoding format. When this header is present, the gateway should compress the response to indicate the client that response is in compressed format. Valid values are: gzip
Header
authorization
String
Yes
Specifies the authorization type and token. "Bearer" + OAuth Token – access_token. If the authorization header is missing, the system shall return an HTTP 400 Invalid Request message. If the token is invalid the system shall return an HTTP 401 Unauthorized message with a WWW-Authenticate HTTP header.
Header
folderId
Integer
Yes
Specifies the id of the folder that needs to be deleted
URI Path

3.22.6.1 Request – Example (Delete a folder)

This demonstrates how to delete a folder.
DELETE /locker/v1/folders/4322132 HTTP/1.1 


Host: api.att.com


authorization: Bearer 38C2399A23999


accept: application/xml

3.22.7 Output Parameters

In the table below, describe output parameters. Where different versions support different output parameters, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table. Note: ‘consent’ refers to end user consent which may need to be obtained before data is returned,
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
content-type
string
yes
Specifies the type of content of the body of the entity. Must be set to one of the following values:
  • application/xml
  • application/json
Note: If there is no entity body in a normal successful response, this parameter is still needed to specify the format in the case of an error response message.
Header
content-encoding
String
No
Specifies the type of encoding used on the data. Supported values are: identity or gzip
Note: If there is no entity body in a normal successful response, this parameter is still needed to specify the format in the case of an error response message.
Header

3.22.7.1 Response – Example (response to a folder deletion)

This shows a successful response to Delete Folder request.
HTTP/1.1 204 No Content


Content-Length: 0


Date: Thu, 04 Jun 2010 02:51:59 GMT

3.23 Operation: Update Folder

3.23.1 Functional Behavior

Describe the functional behavior provided by this operation. Also add here any special considerations, assumptions, and dependencies for this particular operation
Modifies the information of a specific folder belonging to the specified user. If a user attempts to update a folder instance with name of an already existing folder instance, service will throw an exception.

3.23.2 Call flow

Insert below a sequence diagram (ping pong) diagram in context to a complete call flow or transaction with numbered arrows and some description explaining the sequence as appropriate.

3.23.3 Version Impact Summary

Summarize the different versions of this operation that are in production or deleted by the current release of this service.

Subscriber Authorization required?
OAuth Scope Value

authorization_code
Yes
LOCKER
  1. Redirect user to AT&T authorization page to capture User consent
  2. Obtain Token obtained using authorization code issued by the gateway alonf the client key and secret by making an Oauth token call with GrantType=authorization_code

Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
accept
String
No
Specifies the format of the body of the response. Valid values are:
  • application/json
  • application/xml
The default value is application/json. Per rfc2616: "If no Accept header field is present, then it is assumed that the client accepts all media types." By default our services return application/json.
Normal Accept header processing rules shall be followed according to rfc2616.
Note: If there is no entity body in a normal successful response, this parameter can still be specified to determine the format in the case of an error response message.
Header
accept-encoding
String
No
Specifies the accept encoding format. When this header is present, the gateway should compress the response to indicate the client that response is in compressed format. Valid values are: gzip
Header
authorization
String
Yes
Specifies the authorization type and token. "Bearer" + OAuth Token – access_token. If the authorization header is missing, the system shall return an HTTP 400 Invalid Request message. If the token is invalid the system shall return an HTTP 401 Unauthorized message with a WWW-Authenticate HTTP header.
Header
content-length
Integer
No
Specifies the length of the content in octets. This header parameter is only required for the non-streaming request.
Header
content-type
String
Yes
Specifies the type of content of the body of the entity. Must be set to one of the following values:
  • application/json
  • application/xml
Header
folderId
Integer
Yes
Specifies id of the folder that is being updated
URI Path
folder
Object
Yes
Specifies the object that contains the folder information
Body
name
String
No
Specifies the name of the album
Body
description
String
No
Specifies the description of the album
Body
reorder
Object
No

Reorder Object

This table specifies the parameters that belong to the reorder object.

Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
indexes
rename???
are these Integers or Strings??
Array
Yes
Specifies the indexes of the files that need to move.
body
after
rename???
are these Integers or Strings??
Integer
Yes
Specifies the index where the files should be moved after.
body

3.23.6.1 Request – Example (Update a folder - XML)

This demonstrates how to update a folder, and specifying the response to be in XML.
Need to determine if PATCH is correct here, and whether frameworks support it
PATCH /locker/v1/folders/3223232 HTTP/1.1 


Host: api.att.com


content-type: application/xml


authorization: Bearer 38C2399A23999


accept: application/xml




<folder>


      <description>I LIKE THIS NEW DESCRIPTION better.</description>


</folder>

3.23.6.2 Request – Example (Update a folder - JSON)

This demonstrates how to update a folder, the response format will be in JSON.
PATCH /locker/v1/folders/3223232 HTTP/1.1 


Host: api.att.com


content-type: application/json


authorization: Bearer 38C2399A23999


accept: application/json




{


  "folder": { 


      "description": "I LIKE THIS NEW DESCRIPTION better."


  }


}

Specifies the format of the body of the response. Valid values are:
  • application/json
  • application/xml
The default value is application/json. Per rfc2616: "If no Accept header field is present, then it is assumed that the client accepts all media types." By default our services return application/json.
Normal Accept header processing rules shall be followed according to rfc2616.
Note: If there is no entity body in a normal successful response, this parameter can still be specified to determine the format in the case of an error response message.

String
No
Specifies the accept encoding format. When this header is present, the gateway should compress the response to indicate the client that response is in compressed format. Valid values are: gzip
Header
authorization
String
Yes
Specifies the authorization type and token. "Bearer" + OAuth Token – access_token. If the authorization header is missing, the system shall return an HTTP 400 Invalid Request message. If the token is invalid the system shall return an HTTP 401 Unauthorized message with a WWW-Authenticate HTTP header.
Header
folderId
Integer
Yes
Specifies the folder that is being accessed
URI Path
limit
Integer
Yes
Specifies the max number of results returned.
Query Parameter
offset
Integer
Yes
Specifies the scroll set pointer on the results collection.
Query Parameter
orderBy
String
No
Specifies the sorting criteria. Constraints: name, creationdate, size, count
Default: name
Query Parameter
order
String
No
Specifies the sorting order. Constraints: asc, desc
Default: asc
how was this spec'ed in other APIs???
Query Parameter

3.24.6.1 Request – Example (Get folder listing)

This demonstrates how to get folder contents using GET with query parameters, and specifying the response to be in JSON.
GET /locker/v1/folders/22323232?limit=20&offset=10&orderBy=size&order=asc HTTP/1.1 


Host: api.att.com


authorization: Bearer 38C2399A23999


accept: application/json

No

message
String
No

3.24.7.1 Response – Example (Folder Content Listing in XML)

This shows the response to a folder content listing in XML format.
HTTP/1.1 200 OK


content-type: application/xml 


content-length: 539


date: Thu, 04 Jun 2010 02:51:59 GMT




<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>


<content>


    <count>1</count>


    <files>


        <file>


            <accessBlocked>false</accessBlocked>


            <av>


                <status>ok</status>


            </av>


            <contentSize>19152</contentSize>


            <creationDate>05-02-2011 14:07:57 +0000</creationDate>


            <description>UPDATING DESCRIPTION</description>


            <extension>xlsx</extension>


            <format>vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.spreadsheetml.sheet</format>


            <id>112</id>


            <metadataList>


                <metadata>


                    <name>Author</name>


                    <value>Jackie Fong</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>Software</name>


                    <value>Microsoft Excel</value>


                </metadata>


                <metadata>


                    <name>Year</name>


                    <value>2010</value>


                </metadata>


            </metadataList>


            <name>3sScope.xlsx</name>


            <previews/>


            <collections>


                <sets>


                    <count>1</count>


                    <creationDate>05-02-2011 19:11:44 +0000</creationDate>


                    <description>I LIKE THIS NEW DESCRIPTION better.</description>


                    <id>527</id>


                    <name>Bunch of random Files Folder</name>


                    <size>19152</size>


                </sets>


            </collections>


            <shareCodes/>


            <sharingBlocked>false</sharingBlocked>


            <tags/>


            <url>https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/object/?content_id=112&amp;ticket=1b0a8ae1-c17e-45d1-84bc-e110e1323434</url>


        </file>


    </files>


    <total>1</total>


</content>

3.24.7.2 Response – Example (Folder Content Listing in JSON)

This shows the response to a folder content listing in JSON format
HTTP/1.1 200 OK 


content-type: application/json 


content-length: 624 


date: Thu, 04 Jun 2010 02:51:59 GMT




{


  "content": {


    "count": 1,


    "files": {


      "file": {


        "accessBlocked": false,


        "av": { "status": "ok" },


        "creationDate": "05-02-2011 14:07:57 +0000",


        "description": "UPDATING DESCRIPTION",


        "extension": "xlsx",


        "format": "vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.spreadsheetml.sheet",


        "id": 112,


        "metadataList": {


          "metadata": [


            {


              "name": "Author",


              "value": "Jackie Fong"


            },


            {


              "name": "Software",


              "value": "Microsoft Excel"


            },


            {


              "name": "Year",


              "value": "2010"


            }


          ]


        },


        "name": "3sScope.xlsx",


        "collections": {


          "sets": {


            "count": 1,


            "creationDate": "05-02-2011 19:11:44 +0000",


            "description": "I LIKE THIS NEW DESCRIPTION better.",


            "id": 527,


            "name": "Bunch of random Files Folder",


            "size": 19152


          }


        },


        "sharingBlocked": false,


        "url": "https://data.att-integration4.sdc.f-secure.com/data/1_0_0/object/?content_id=112&ticket=1b0a8ae1-c17e-45d1-84bc-e110e1323434"


      }


    },


    "total": 1


  }


}

3.24.8 HTTP Response Codes

List expected response codes (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
Code
Reason Phrase
Description
200
OK
Successful response
400
Bad Request
Many possible reasons not specified by the other codes.
401
Authentication Error
Authentication failed or was not provided.
403
Forbidden
Access permission error.
404
Not Found
The server has not found anything matching the Request-URI. No indication is given of whether the condition is temporary or permanent.
414
Request-URI Too Long
The server is refusing to service the request because the Request-URI is longer than the server is willing to interpret.
500
Internal Server Error
The server encountered an internal error or timed out; please retry.
503
Service Unavailable
The server is currently unable to receive requests; please retry.

3.24.9 Service Exceptions

List the service exceptions generated by the operation (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
MessageId
Text
Variables
Parent HTTP Code
SVC0001
A service error has occurred. Error code is <Error Explanation>
Error Explanation : <content here>
400
SVC0002
Invalid input value for Message part <part name>
part name : name of the input parameter that resulted in the error
400
SVC0003
Invalid input value for Message part <part name>, valid values are <part values>
part value : value of input parameter that was found to be in error.
400

3.24.10 Policy Exceptions

List the policy exceptions generated by the operation (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
MessageId
Text
Variables
Parent HTTP Code
POL0001
A policy error occurred. For example, rate limit error, authentication and authorization error.
N/A
401,403
POL1009
User has not been provisioned for %1
System that hasn’t been provisioned
403

3.25 Operation: Add Files to Folder

3.25.1 Functional Behavior

Describe the functional behavior provided by this operation. Also add here any special considerations, assumptions, and dependencies for this particular operation
Add a list of file into an existing folder. Adding the same file twice in a folder is allowed. A folder “Antarctica” contains File1.txt
If a user selects 3 files, File1.txt, File2.txt, File3.txt and adds them to the folder “Antarctica”, folder “Antarctica” will contain, the following: File1.txt, File1.txt, File2.txt and File3.txt.

3.25.2 Call flow

Insert below a sequence diagram (ping pong) diagram in context to a complete call flow or transaction with numbered arrows and some description explaining the sequence as appropriate.

3.25.3 Version Impact Summary

Summarize the different versions of this operation that are in production or deleted by the current release of this service.
Service Version
Major or Minor Impact
Changes Introduced by this Version
1
Major
Initial Release

3.25.4 Authentication and Authorization

Describe OAuth model applicable to this operation.
Authorization Model
Subscriber Authorization required?
OAuth Scope Value
Brief Description
OAuth
authorization_code
Yes
LOCKER
  1. Redirect user to AT&T authorization page to capture User consent
  2. Obtain Token obtained using authorization code issued by the gateway alonf the client key and secret by making an Oauth token call with GrantType=authorization_code

3.25.5 Representation Formats

In the table below, describe supported representation formats for the request and response body. Where different versions support different formats, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table.
Direction
Supported Representation Formats
Request
XML, JSON
Response
XML, JSON

3.25.6 Input Parameters

In the table below, describe input parameters. Where different versions support different input parameters, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table. The allowed values for the Location in Request column are: Header, Resource URI, Body or Query Parameter.
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
accept
String
No
Specifies the format of the body of the response. Valid values are:
  • application/json
  • application/xml
The default value is application/json. Per rfc2616: "If no Accept header field is present, then it is assumed that the client accepts all media types." By default our services return application/json.
Normal Accept header processing rules shall be followed according to rfc2616.
Note: If there is no entity body in a normal successful response, this parameter can still be specified to determine the format in the case of an error response message.
Header
accept-encoding
String
No
Specifies the accept encoding format. When this header is present, the gateway should compress the response to indicate the client that response is in compressed format. Valid values are: gzip
Header
authorization
String
Yes
Specifies the authorization type and token. "Bearer" + OAuth Token – access_token. If the authorization header is missing, the system shall return an HTTP 400 Invalid Request message. If the token is invalid the system shall return an HTTP 401 Unauthorized message with a WWW-Authenticate HTTP header.
Header
content-length
Integer
No
Specifies the length of the content in octets. This header parameter is only required for the non-streaming request.
Header
content-type
String
Yes
Specifies the type of content of the body of the entity. Must be set to one of the following values:
  • application/json
  • application/xml
Header
folderId
Integer
Yes
Specifies the id of the folder where the files will be placed.
URI Path
fileIds
Object
Yes
Contains the file information to be added
Body
id
Array
Yes
Specifies the ids of the files that are to be added to the folder.
Body
index
Integer
No
Specifies the absolute position where you want to place the new files.
Default is to put at the end of the folder.
Body

3.25.6.1 Request – Example (Add files to a folder in XML)

This demonstrates how to add a file to a folder, and specifying the request to be in XML.
POST /locker/v1/folders/3433435/files HTTP/1.1 


Host: api.att.com


content-type: application/xml


authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678


accept: application/xml




<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" ?>


<fileIds>


    <id>112</id>


    <id>125</id>


    <index>1</index>  	


</fileIds>

3.25.6.2 Request – Example (Add files to a folder in JSON)

This demonstrates how to add a file to a folder, and specifying the request to be in JSON.
POST /locker/v1/folders/3433435/files HTTP/1.1 


Host: api.att.com


content-type: application/json


authorization: Bearer abcdef12345678


accept: application/json




{


  "fileIds": {


    "id": [112,125],


    "index": 1


  }


}

3.25.7 Output Parameters

In the table below, describe output parameters. Where different versions support different output parameters, provide separate tables and indicate which versions apply to each table. Note: ‘consent’ refers to end user consent which may need to be obtained before data is returned,
Parameter
Data Type
Req?
Brief description
Location
content-type
string
yes
Specifies the type of content of the body of the entity. Must be set to one of the following values:
  • application/json
  • aplication/xml
Note: If there is no entity body in a normal successful response, this parameter is still needed to specify the format in the case of an error response message.
Header

3.25.7.1 Response – Example (Response to adding files to a folder)

This shows the response to a an add file to folder request.
HTTP/1.1 204 No Content


Date: Thu, 04 Jun 2010 02:51:59 GMT

3.25.8 HTTP Response Codes

List expected response codes (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
Code
Reason Phrase
Description
204
No Content
Successful response and the response does not include an entity.
400
Bad Request
Many possible reasons not specified by the other codes.
401
Authentication Error
Authentication failed or was not provided.
403
Forbidden
Access permission error.
404
Not Found
The server has not found anything matching the Request-URI. No indication is given of whether the condition is temporary or permanent.
405
Method Not Allowed
A request was made of a resource using a request method not supported by that resource (e.g., using PUT on a REST resource that only supports POST).
408
Request Timeout
The client did not produce a request within the time that the server was prepared to wait. The client MAY repeat the request without modifications at any later time.
411
Length Required
The Content-Length header was not specified.
413
Request Entity Too Large
The size of the request body exceed the maximum size permitted.
415
Unsupported Media Type
The request is in a format not supported by the requested resource for the requested method.
500
Internal Server Error
The server encountered an internal error or timed out; please retry.
503
Service Unavailable
The server is currently unable to receive requests; please retry.

3.25.9 Service Exceptions

List the service exceptions generated by the operation (indicate any variation that exists across different versions):
MessageId
Text
Variables
Parent HTTP Code
SVC0001
A service error has occurred. Error code is <Error Explanation>
Error Explanation : <content here>
400
SVC0002
Invalid input value for Message part <part name>
part name : name of the input parameter that resulted in the error
400
